Dr. Chang is active in standardization activities, specifically in IETF and ETSI. He is the editor of the RFC standard and contributes to many RFC standards developed under the IETF 6TiSCH working group. He was also recruited as technical expertise during 3 ETSI 6TiSCH interoperability test events. After 5 years living in France, Dr. Chang moved to California in 2021 and co-founded MonoLets, Inc, a start-up based in Silicon Valley, aiming to provide tracking service for logistic supply chains with paper-thin active electronic labels. Before joining the industry, Dr. Chang has authorized over 30 international publications, including journals with high impact factor and high rank conferences, one U.S. pattern and one RFC standard. His current research interests are on massive low-power sensor/actuator networks, Indoor wireless localization, Single-Chip micro-Mote (SCuM) and Swarm Robotics.
Research Interest: ['Low-Power Wireless Mesh Networks', 'Indoor Wireless Localization', 'Sensor Fusion', 'Swarm Robotics/Intelligence']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Huangxun Chen is currently an Assistant Professor in the Internet of Things Thrust at the Information Hub of Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). Prior to her role at HKUST-GZ, Dr. Chen served as a Researcher at Huawei Hong Kong Research Center from October 2020 to August 2023. During her time there, she led a project that focused on the automated generation and translation of network configurations and played a key role in transferring these techniques to enhance the efficiency of network configuration management within Huawei's product groups. Dr. Chen received her Ph.D. degree in Computer Science and Engineering from the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology in August 2020, and obtained her B.S. degree in Computer Science and Technology from Shanghai Jiaotong University in 2015. Dr. Chen's research spans the areas of network management, cyber-physical security, intelligent sensing, and their intersection with machine learning techniques. Her works have been published across venues in the network, ubiquitous computing, and machine learning, including SIGCOMM, IMWUT/UBICOMP, AAAI, INFOCOM, etc. She received the Best Paper Award from ACM SIGCOMM in 2022.
Research Interest: ['Internet of Things', 'Cyber-physical/AI Security ', 'Intelligent Network OAM', 'Human-centered Interaction System']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Carbon Neutrality and Climate Change
Overview: Dr. Luoye Chen is an Assistant Professor of Carbon Neutrality and Climate Change and a Joint Assistant Professor of Innovation, Policy and Entrepreneurship at the Society Hub of Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou).  He received his PhD in Applied and Agricultural Economics from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. Dr. Luoye Chen is an applied economist working at the intersection of environmental and agricultural economics, with a particular emphasis on land use, renewable energy production, and ecosystem services. Luoye’s past work has comprehensively examined the cost-effectiveness of biofuel and conservation policies in US and their unintended environmental consequences. His current research seeks to understand (1) how market conditions, climate change, air pollution, and policy intervention affects agricultural production decisions; (2) the adoption of sustainable production technology; (3) natural-based solution to carbon neutrality. Much of his work uses satellite data, remote sensing products, and machine learning methods to help answer policy questions.
Research Interest: ['Fields: Environmental and Natural Resource Economics, Sustainable Agriculture Development', 'Methodological Interests: Data Science and Computational Methods, Spatial Analysis, Machine Learning in Policy Evaluation. ']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Mojun Chen obtained his Ph.D. degree in Mechanical Engineering from The University of Hong Kong, M.S. degree in Modern Mechanics from University of Science and Technology of China, and B.S. degree in Mechanical Engineering from Air Force Engineering University. He worked as a Postdoctoral Fellow at The University of Hong Kong before joining the Smart Manufacturing Thrust, Systems Hub, The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou) as Assistant Professor in 2022. His research interests include micro/nanoscale 3D printing, optoelectronics, micro/nanorobotics, and wearable devices. Over the past five years, he has authored/co-authored more than 15 peer-reviewed journal papers, including Advanced Materials (front cover), Nano Letters, ACS Nano, Small (frontispiece) wherein he is the first author. He was a recipient of 2019 Best Poster Award from Workshop on Electronic Materials and Devices (HKU), 2014 Young Researcher Award from the 4th International Conference on Experimental Fluid Mechanics (3 winners), 2013 Outstanding Paper Award from the 9th National Conference on Experimental Fluid Mechanics.
Research Interest: ['Micro/nanoscale 3D printing', 'Optoelectronics', 'Micro/nanorobotics', 'Wearable devices']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Peng Chen, Assistant Professor of Advanced Materials Thrust, Function Hub, HKUST(GZ). He obtained his PhD degree from Shanghai institute of optics and fine mechanics, the Chinese academy of sciences. Before joining HKUST (GZ), he worked as a senior researcher at Hefei national laboratory for physical sciences at the microscale, Shanghai branch of university of science and technology of China(2015-2018), and research assistant professor in HKUST (2019-2022). Prof. Chen has extensive research experiences in diverse experimental fields of atomic, molecular, and optical physics, including quantum optics, ultracold atoms, Rydberg atoms, quantum metrology and surface optics. His research works have been published in top peer-reviewed journals including nature communications, physical review letters, Optica, etc.  Prof. Chen has several technical patents, including patents under review.
Research Interest: ['Experimental quantum information science', 'Quantum few-body system', 'Quantum optics', 'Artificial quantum materials', 'Ultracold physics', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Novel microscopy']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Ying-Cong Chen is an Assistant Professor at AI Thrust, Information Hub of Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). He is also an Affiliated Assistant Professor of the department of Computer Science & Engineering (Clear Water Bay Campus). He was a Postdoctoral Associate at Computer Science & Artificial Intelligence Lab of Massachusetts Institute of Technology, working with Prof. Dina Katabi. He obtained his Ph.D. degree from the Chinese University of Hong Kong, working with Prof. Jiaya Jia. His research lies in the broad area of computer vision and machine learning, aiming for empowering machine with the capacity to understand human appearance, physiology and psychology. His works contribute to a wide range of applications, including contactless health monitoring, semantic photo synthesis, and intelligent video surveillance.
Research Interest: ['Computer Vision', 'Machine Learning']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Bojun Cheng is an Assistant Professor in the Thrust of Microelectronics of the Function Hub at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou), China. He received his B.E. from School of the Gifted Young, University of Science and Technology of China in 2012, and Ph.D. from the ETH Zurich in 2021 (advised by Prof. Juerg Leuthold). His research has mainly focused on memristive devices and memristor-based neuromorphic computing, and optical interconnects for neuromorphic computing chips.
Research Interest: ['memristive devices and memristor-based neuromorphic computing', 'scaleble CMOS neuromorphic computing', 'optical interconnects for ANN']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Earth, Ocean and Atmospheric Sciences
Overview: Dr. Chi is a biometeorologist, a researcher at the interface between meteorology and biology. For my interdisciplinary research, I strive to understand the various ways that the biosphere and the atmosphere interact and how these processes are modulated by the changing climate and human activities. Central research themes are the carbon, water, and energy budgets. My research approach involves the use of field measurements (mostly eddy covariance and other micrometeorological methods) at simple and homogeneous sites as well as complex and heterogeneous lands from plot to landscape scales.
Research Interest: ['Terrestrial carbon and water cycles', 'Land-atmosphere interactions', 'Eddy covariance']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Bioscience and Biomedical Engineering
Overview: Dr. Lingluo Chu is an Assistant Professor in Bioscience and Biomedical Engineering Thrust at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). Dr. Chu obtained his Ph.D. in Cell Biology from the University of Science and Technology of China (USTC) to study SUV39H1-HP1-histone H3 signal axis in mediating mitosis and chromosome dynamics. Since the end of 2014, he joined the Department of Molecular and Cell Biology at Harvard University for postdoctoral training (Nancy Kleckner lab). In 2019, he was hired as a Research Associate at Harvard University to continue his research on the biophysics of mammalian cell chromosomes. Dr. Chu joined the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou) in 2022. Dr Chu’s interests focus on chromosome morphogenesis and chromosome instability. Through high spatiotemporal resolution in vivo imaging, combining methods and technologies such as Crispr/Cas9 gene editing, optogenetics, image recognition, machine learning, and 3D simulation reconstruction, the molecular and physical mechanisms involved in chromosome assembly and segregation events are revealed, thereby further explore the molecular mechanism of the occurrence and development of chromosomal instability, and provide cytological evidence for the diagnosis and treatment of related diseases.
Research Interest: ['Chromosome architecture and dynamics', 'Chromosome instability and innate immunity', 'Cell dynamics and AI']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Chu received his B.S. degree in physics and Ph.D. degree in theoretical physics from Jilin University. From 2014 to 2015, he was a Research Assistant at Changchun Institute of Applied Chemistry. From 2015 to 2018, he conducted postdoctoral research at IMDEA-Nanoscience Institute in Madrid, Spain. In the summer of 2018, he moved to US and worked as a Postdoctoral Researcher at Chemistry department, Stony Brook University. His current research focuses on theoretical and computational molecular biophysics. He develops computational models and uses molecular dynamics simulations to study biomolecular structures and dynamics, including multidomain protein folding, protein-protein/DNA recognition, and chromosome structural organization.
Research Interest: ['Theoretical and computational biophysics ', 'Coarse-grained biomolecular model ', 'Flexible biomolecular structure and function ']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Prof. Cui received his Bechalor's degree from Shandong University in Mechanical Engineering and Ph.D. degree from the University of California, Los Angeles in the field of additive manufacturing and metamaterials. From 2020 to 2022, he worked as a postdoctoral scholar at UCLA and focused on the development of multi-material 3D printing platforms and multi-functional metamaterials. In 2023, he joined the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou) as an Assistant Professor. Prof. Cui has published his research work in the most prestigious journals, including Science, Nature Electronics, Nature Materials, Materials Horizons and Advanced Functional Materials, etc. He has been the reviewer of 7 international journals and authored 2 patents in additive manufacturing in the US.
Research Interest: ['Advanced additive manufacturing techniques ', 'Design, manufacturing and characterization of multifunctional materials ', 'Robotics and autonomous systems via additive manufacturing', 'Development of 3D-printed medical devices ']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Prof. Juan Du holds a Ph.D. degree in Management Science and Engineering from the Department of Industrial Engineering & Management at Peking University and a BEng in Composite Materials and Engineering from Honors School of Harbin Institute of Technology. She had been a Visiting/Joint Ph.D. Student at H. Milton Stewart School of Industrial & Systems Engineering of Georgia Tech from 2017-2019 during her Ph.D. study. She worked as Assistant Professor at the Department of Industrial Engineering & Management at Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China before joining the Smart Manufacturing Thrust, Systems Hub, The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou) as Assistant Professor in 2021. She is a recipient of INFORMS Quality Reliability and Statistics Best Refereed Paper Finalist Award in 2018, INFORMS Data Mining Best Paper Finalist Award in 2019 and 2020, and ASA Quality and Productivity Joint Research Conference Travel Award in 2018. She is also a recipient of the Outstanding Ph.D. Thesis Award from the Chinese Society of Management Science and Engineering in 2020 and the Peking University in 2019. Her research is supported by NSFC and other funding agencies. Prof. Du's group has opennings for Ph.D. students, Mphil students, postdocs, and visiting research students. Highly self-motivated students from top universities with background in automation, statistics, mechnanical engineering, computer science and engineering and other related fields are encouraged to apply. If you are interested, please send your information (e.g. CV, transcripts, and TOEFL/IELTS scores) to juandu@ust.hk.
Research Interest: ['Knowledge-infused data science for quality improvement', 'Industrial data analytics and machine learning', 'System informatics and control for manufacturing applications']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Computational Media and Arts
Overview: Mingming Fan is an Assistant Professor in the Computational Media and Arts (CMA) Thrust and the Division of Integrative Systems and Design (ISD) at The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST) in its Guangzhou (GZ) and Clear Water Bay (CWB) campuses. He is also an Affiliated Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering. Currently, he serves as the Postgraduate (PG) program Coordinator for CMA. Before joining HKUST, he was a tenure-track Assistant Professor at the Rochester Institute of Technology (RIT) in the US from 2019 to 2021. He received a Ph.D. from the Department of Computer Science at the University of Toronto in 2019.Dr. Fan leads the Accessible & Pervasive User EXperience (APEX) Group to research in the fields of Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) and Accessibility. Specifically, his group investigates 1) Accessibility and Aging Challenges, 2) VR/AR/XR/Metaverse: Novel Input/Output techniques, Applications, and Empirical Studies; 3) Human-AI Collaboration, 4) Ubiquitous Sensing Techniques and Applications, and 5) UX and Social Computing. His research won Best Paper Award, Best Paper Honorable Mention Award, and Best Artifact Award from top-tier venues in HCI and Accessibility, such as CHI, UbiComp, and ASSETS.
Research Interest: ['Human-Computer Interaction (HCI)', 'Virtual Reality (VR) / Augmented Reality (AR) / Metaverse: Input/Output techniques, Novel Applications, and Empirical Studies', 'Accessibility and Aging (especially Assistive Technology Design for People with Different Types of Disabilities and Older Adults)', 'Human-AI Collaboration ', 'Ubiquitous Sensing Techniques and Applications ', 'User Experience (UX)', 'Social Computing and Computational Social Science', 'Creativity Support Tool Design']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Sustainable Energy and Environment
Overview: Dr. Ting Fang is an assistant professor at the Sustainable Energy and Environment, the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). She graduated from Sun Yat-sen University in Environmental Engineering as a bachelor and obtained her doctoral degree in Atmospheric Sciences from Georgia Institute of Technology. She has worked as a postdoctoral researcher at Georgia Institute of Technology and University of California, Irvine before she joined HKUST(GZ) in 2023. Her research interests focus on indoor and outdoor air pollution and human health specifically on free radical generation in field of Environmental Science and Toxicology. Her work combines field measurements, laboratory experiments, and computational simulation to study the oxidative potential, environmental persistent free radicals, chemical and cellular reactive oxygen species in particulate matter to understand their sources, reaction mechanisms, and health effects of air pollutants. Dr. Fang has published 26 peer-reviewed articles including 9 (co-)first-authored papers with a google citation of more than 2200 times. She was an awardee of the John Bradshaw Award at Georgia Tech and was selected as a participant of Atmospheric Chemistry Colloquium for Emerging Senior Scientists (ACCESS XV) in 2019.
Research Interest: ['Atmospheric Chemistry', 'Chemical Biology', 'Outdoor and Indoor Aerosols', 'Health-related Aerosols', 'Cell Toxicity', 'Long-and Short-lived Free Radicals']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Zecheng Gan is now an assistant professor of Advanced Materials of the Function Hub at HKUST(GZ), and an affiliate assistant professor in the Department of Mathematics, School of Science at HKUST(CWB). He obtained his PhD from Shanghai Jiao Tong University, under the supervision of Prof. Zhenli Xu (2010-2016), and worked as a postdoc assistant professor in mathematics at University of Michigan, Ann Arbor (2016-2019) and then postdoc associate at Courant institute, New York university until August 2021 before joining HKUST. Broadly, his research interest includes applied and computational mathematics, scientific computing, machine learning and data-driven methods, and their applications in interdisciplinary sciences. More specifically, his research focuses on the development of efficient, accurate and scalable numerical methods for the modeling and simulations of complex fluids at mesoscopic scales, with broad applications in soft condensed matter physics, materials science and biology.
Research Interest: ['Applied math', 'Computational electromagnetism and hydrodynamics', 'Computational materials science', 'Data-driven and machine learning methods']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Urban Governance and Design
Overview: Dr. Zhigang GE is an assistant professor at HKUST (GZ) since Sep 2020. He received his Ph.D. degree from the Department of Economics at the University of Wisconsin-Madison. His research areas are macroeconomics, wealth and income inequality, and dynamic optimal taxation.
Research Interest: ['Macroeconomics', 'Wealth and Income Inequality', 'Dynamic Optimal Taxation']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Zijun GONG received the B.Eng. and M.Eng. degrees on communication engineering, from the Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China, in 2013 and 2015, respectively, and the Ph.D. degree in electrical and computer engineering from the Memorial University of Newfoundland, St. John's, NL, Canada, in 2021. Upon graduation, he received the prestigious Postdoctoral Fellowship from the NSERC (National Sciences and Engineering Research Council) of Canada. He is currently a Postdoctoral Fellow with Prof. Xuemin (Shermen) Shen 's BBCR lab, University of Waterloo, Waterloo, ON, Canada, working on real-time communications, localization, and tracking in vehicular networks. He has wide research interests on statistical optimization in communications and localization, such as WLAN fingerprint-based indoor localization systems, radio propagation modeling, underwater localization, and machine-learning assisted target tracking. He has also conducted fruitful research on channel estimation and tracking in massive MIMO, and millimeter wave communications. He was the recipient of the Best Paper Award at the IEEE Globecom’17, Singapore, in December 2017.
Research Interest: ['Signal processing for wireless communications', 'Channel estimation and channel tracking', 'Array signal processing for communications and localization', 'Stochastic signal process and optimization', 'Target detection recognition, localization and tracking (Radar and Sonar)']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Computational Media and Arts
Overview: Dr Varvara Guljajeva has a PhD in Philosophy from the Estonian Academy of Arts, a master’s degree in digital media from ISNM, the University of Lübeck in Germany, and a bachelor’s degree in IT from Estonian IT College. Varvara Guljajeva is an artist and researcher. Currently, she holds the positions of researcher and guest Associate Professor in Textile at the Estonian Academy of Arts. Varvara has been invited as a visiting researcher to XRL, Hong Kong City University, IAMAS (Ogaki, Japan), LJMU (Liverpool, UK), Interface Cultures in the Linz University of Art and Design, Blekinge Institute of Technology (Karlshamn, Sweden).As an artist, she works together with Mar Canet forming an artist duo Varvara & Mar. Often duo’s work is inspired by the information age. In their practice, they confront social changes and the impact of the technological era. The duo has been exhibiting in international shows since 2009. Their works have been shown at MAD in New York, FACT in Liverpool, Santa Monica in Barcelona, Barbican in London, Onassis Cultural Centre in Athens, Ars Electronica museum in Linz, ZKM in Karlsruhe, and more.

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Sustainable Energy and Environment
Overview: Dr HAN Wei is an Assistant Professor in Sustainable Energy and Environment Thrust at Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou) since October 2021. He was a Postdoctoral Fellow at University of Toronto in Prof. Peter W. Lehn’s Group from 2020 to 2021. He received the M.Eng. and Ph.D. degrees in Electrical and Electronic Engineering from The University of Hong Kong in 2015 and 2020, respectively, supervised by Prof. K. T. Chau and Prof. C. C. Chan. He received his B.Eng. degree in Electrical Engineering and Automation from Northeastern University, China, in 2014.His research interests include power electronics, wireless power transfer, electric vehicle energy technologies, electric machines and drives. Dr. Han has published over 40 journal papers in aforementioned areas. He acts as reviewers of multiple TOP journals and he is currently a Guest Editor of Energies.
Research Interest: ['Wireless Power Transfer (WPT)', 'Power Electronics', 'Electric Vehicle (EV) Technologies', 'Electric Machinery']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Dengbo He is an Assistant Professor in the Intelligent Transportation Thrust and the Robotics and Autonomous Systems Thrust of the System Hub, and an Affiliate Assistant Professor in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST). Dr. He received his Ph.D degree from the University of Toronto in 2020, his M.Sc. degree from Shanghai Jiao Tong University in 2016 and his B.Sc. degree from Hunan University in 2012. He was a Postdoc Fellow at the University of Toronto before joining HKUST in 2021.His research focuses on understanding and improving human behaviour and performance in multi-task and complex situations (e.g., driving with automation), using a wide range of analytical techniques. His current research invests on driving safety, passenger comfort in automated vehicles, driver behaviours with driving automation, drivers’ states detection, and other road agents’ interactions with automated and semi-automated vehicles. His research has been focused on the following directions: Human Factors, Driver Behaviors, Driving Automation, Distracted Driving and Driver State Estimation.
Research Interest: ['Human Factors', 'Driver Behaviors', 'Driving Automation', 'Distracted Driving', 'Driver State Estimation']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Innovation, Policy and Entrepreneurship
Overview: Dr. Yun Hou is interested in researching and teaching innovation and entrepreneurship. She got her Ph.D. degree at the Department of Strategy and Policy, NUS Business School in November, 2021.She joined the Innovation, Policy, and Entrepreneurship Thrust of the Society Hub of The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou) as an Assistant Professor beginning from Fall 2022.
Research Interest: ['Entrepreneurial learning', 'Innovation strategy']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Guobiao Hu is currently an assistant professor with the IoT Thrust at HKUST(GZ). He received his Ph.D. degree in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Auckland, New Zealand, and his bachelor & master degrees from Southwest Jiaotong University, China. He also obtained a diploma d'ingeneur from the École centrale de Paris, France. Before joining HKUST(GZ), he worked as a Research Fellow in the School of Civil and Environmental Engineering, at Nanyang Technological University. His research interests include vibration energy harvesting, acoustic-elastic metamaterials, and intelligent material structures & systems. Dr. Hu has published more than 80 peer-reviewed technical papers in prestigious journals and international conferences, with 5 being ESI highly cited papers. He was a recipient of the Best Paper Finalist Award at the SPIE Conference on Smart Structures/NDE in 2018. He has filed 3 patents, including 1 Singapore patent and 2 Chinese patents. According to Google Scholar statistics in April 2023, his publications have received over 1700 citations with an H-index of 22. He is featured in the world's top 2% of Scientists List (2022) identified by Stanford University. He serves as reviewer for more than 50 SCI journals and guest editor for the Journal of Physics D: Applied Physics and ASCE Journal of Environmental Engineering.
Research Interest: ['Vibration energy harvesting', 'Acoustic-elastic metamaterials', 'Smart materials and structures', 'Nonlinear dynamics and vibration', 'Structural health monitoring']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Sustainable Energy and Environment
Overview: Dr. Jiaqiang HUANG is an Assistant Professor in Sustainable Energy and Environment Thrust at Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou) since January 2022. He graduated with his Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering degree from Shanghai Jiao Tong University with the Shanghai Excellent Graduate Award in 2013. He then obtained his Ph.D. degree in Mechanical Engineering from the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology in 2017. Afterwards, he has worked as a postdoc in Hong Kong Polytechnic University and Collège de France with Biao Zhang and Jean-Marie Tarascon, respectively. Dr. Huang’s research interests centre around batteries, particularly at the interface between novel sensors and new material/chemistry. In addition to 4 patents, he has published 39 peer-reviewed journal papers, including 12 first-authored papers in the most prestigious journals in the fields, such as Nature Energy, Nature Sustainability, Energy & Environmental Science x2, Advanced Energy Materials, Advanced Functional Materials, and Journal of Electrochemical Society. Two of these papers are ESI highly cited.
Research Interest: ['Battery sensors', 'Electrochemical energy storage', 'Data-driven battery diagnostics/prognostics ', 'AI + Battery + Sensors']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Jiayi Huang is an Assistant Professor of the Microelectronics Thrust at The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). Prior to joining HKUST(GZ), he was a research scientist at Alibaba DAMO Academy and a postdoc at UC Santa Barabara. He received the Ph.D. in Computer Engineering from Texas A&M University in 2020, and the B.Eng. degree from Zhejiang University in 2014. His research interests lie in the fields of computer architecture and systems. His research is mainly published in Computer Architecture top venues such as ISCA, HPCA, and TC. He has interned at Tesla and worked on the memory controller design of Autopilot Hardware. He was a recipient of the TAMU Dissertation Fellowship, his work has been nominated for the DATE 2022 Best Paper Award.
Research Interest: ['Computer Architecture', 'Networks-on-Chip', 'Interconnection Network', 'Security']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Shanshi Huang is an Assistant Professor at the Microelectronics Thrust, Function Hub in the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). She received her B.E from Beijing Institute of tehcnology in 2012, M.S. from Arizona State University in 2012 and Ph.D degree from Georgia Institute of Technology in 2022. From 2015 to 2016, she worked at Marvell Tehcnology Inc as a physical design engineer. Her research has mainly focused on device, circuit, architecture and algorithm cross-layer hardware & software co-design. Her research interests also include heterogeneous computing, EDA design and hardware security for AI chips. She has published 25+ papers in peer-reviewed conferences and journals (including ICCAD, CICC, IEDM, DATE, TVLSI).
Research Interest: ['cross-layer hardware & software co-design', 'EDA design', 'Hardware security', 'heterogeneous computing']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Zhiqiang Huang is an Assistant Professor at the Microelectronics Thrust, Function Hub of the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). He received Ph.D. degree from the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology in 2017 and B.Eng. degree from University of Electronic Science and Technology of China in 2012. In 2018, he joined Samsung Semiconductor Inc and worked on high-speed SerDes transceiver, WiFi and 5G mmWave Transceivers. In 2022, he joined HKUST (GZ) as Assistant Professor at the Microelectronics Thrust of Function Hub. He received the IEEE SSCS Predoctoral Achievement Award 2016-2017 and published 7 first-author peer-reviewed journal and conference papers (3 ISSCC, 1 JSSC, 2 TCAS-I and 1 VLSI). His research interests include Analog/RF and mm-wave integrated circuit design, frequency synthesis from RF to sub-THz, optical/electrical wireline transceiver design and low power integrated circuit design.
Research Interest: ['Analog/RF/mm-wave integrated circuit design', 'Frequency synthesis from RF to sub-THz', 'Low power integrated circuit design']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Earth, Ocean and Atmospheric Sciences
Overview: Dr Ji is a chemical oceanographer interested in isotope tracing marine biogeochemical processes, nitrous oxide production in aquatic systems, and isotope instrumentation. At present, he is investigating the coupling of nitrogen cycling processes and microbial interactions, as well as calibrating ocean biogeochemical models to characterize the ocean’s future under the profound impact of anthropogenic activities.
Research Interest: ['Nitrogen biogeochemistry', 'Stable isotope geochemistry and instrumentation', 'greenhouse gas']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Robotics and Autonomous Systems
Overview: Yiding JI received the Bachelor's degree of Electrical Engineering and its Automation from Tianjin University, China in 2014. Then he received the Master's as well as Doctor's degree of Electrical and Computer Engineering both from the University of Michigan, United States in 2016 and 2019, respectively. Since then, he worked as a postdoc researcher at Division of Systems Engineering of Boston University, United States.  His research interests include control theory, discrete event systems, formal methods, optimization, machine learning, game theory and cyber security/privacy.  He is a member of IEEE and IEEE Control Systems Society Technical Community on Discrete Event Systems.
Research Interest: ['Automatic Control, Formal Methods, Discrete Event Systems, Hybrid Systems, Machine Learning, Algorithmic Game Theory, Cyber Security and Privacy, Automation Engineering Software, Internet of Things, Smart Autonomy']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Shuai Jia obtained a Ph.D. in Transport and Logistics Management from Department of Logistics and Maritime Studies, The Hong Kong Polytechnic University in 2019. Prior to joining Intelligent Transportation Thrust, Systems Hub, The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology as an assistant professor in 2022, he was a research fellow at Institute of Operations Research and Analytics and Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering, National University of Singapore, during 2020 and 2021. He also served as a software and system engineer at Shanghai International Port (Group) Co., Ltd. during 2012 and 2015, where he developed multiple decision support systems for port logistics management optimization. Dr. Shuai Jia's research area includes data-driven modeling and optimization and large-scale integer programming, with applications to transportation and logistics management and decision support system development.
Research Interest: ['Data-driven Modeling and Optimization', 'Large-scale Integer Programming', 'Transport and Logistics Management', 'Decision Support Systems']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Hongwu Jiang is an Assistant Professor at the Microelectronics Thrust, Function Hub in the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). He received his Ph.D degree from Georgia Institute of Technology in 2022. His research interests include AI chip design, mixed-signal integrated circuit design and memory design, especially focusing on eNVM-based, 3D integrated and Compute-in-Memory based circuit and architecture design. He has published 20+ papers in peer-reviewed conferences and journals, including Symposium on VLSI, DAC, IEEE TCAS-I, IEEE Trans. on Computer. One of his research was nominated for Best Paper Award in DAC 2020.
Research Interest: ['in-memory computing', 'AI hardware accelerator design', '3D integrated circuit design']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Zhilu Lai is a tenure-track assistant professor at Internet of Things Thrust, Information Hub, jointly with Intelligent Transportation Thrust, System Hub, HKUST(GZ), as well as an affiliate assistant professor in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering at HKUST. Prior to his current position, he served as a postdoctoral researcher at ETH-Zurich. Dr. Lai holds a Ph.D.  in Structural Engineering from Rice University. Dr. Lai focuses on developing innovative methodologies for assimilating sensor data into the modeling, condition assessment, diagnostics, and digitalization of engineering systems. His work encompasses theoretical, analytical, and experimental studies, with the ultimate goal of advancing our understanding of complex engineering systems and improving their performance. He has received multiple scholarships and awards, including Rice Global Engineering and Construction Forum Scholarship, and the Outstanding Reviewer of Journal of Mechanical Systems and Signal Processing award. He serves as a committee member on ASCE-EMI Dynamics Committee, Structural Health Monitoring and  Control Committee. He serves as a guest editor of Journal of Structural Engineering (ASCE).

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Urban Governance and Design
Overview: Dr. Chaosu LI is an assistant professor in the Urban Governance and Design Thrust Area at Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). Previously, he was a postdoctoral researcher at the Center for Urban and Regional Studies (CURS), University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill (UNC-Chapel Hill). Dr. Li received his Ph.D. in City and Regional Planning from UNC-Chapel Hill in 2018. He has expertise in urban form, urban sustainability and resilience, applied GIS and urban big data analytics. His work has been published in the Journal of the American Planning Association(JAPA), Journal of Planning Education and Research(JPER), Environment and Planning A, Land Use Policy, Journal of Environmental Management, Journal of Environmental Planning and Management, Renewable and Sustainable Energy Reviews, Energy and Buildings, plus other journals. Dr. Li’s previous research projects have been supported by the Macao Foundation, etc.
Research Interest: ['Urban Planning and Governance', 'Urban Form', 'Climate Change Planning', 'Applied GIS and Urban Big Data Analytics']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Innovation, Policy and Entrepreneurship
Overview: Dr. Chenyang Li an assistant professor in IPE Thrust (department), at Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (GZ). Driven by a passion for bridging the gap between economic theory and empirical works in the fields of game theory and industrial organization. His research encompasses both economic theory and empirical projects. In my theory papers, he delves into understanding how communication network structures influence the success of group collective action. The implications of his research findings extend to various fields, including firm management and anti-corruption. In addition, his other empirical projects are focused on the digital economy, pricing strategy on online platforms, and the interaction between online and offline businesses.He is committed to generating new insights that can benefit both the academic community and the industry at large. He looks forward to sharing my research findings and contributing to the discourse on economics.
Research Interest: ['Industrial Organization', 'Platform', 'Digital Economics', 'Game Theory', 'Network Theory', 'Business Economics']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Haoxiang Li is currently an assistant professor of Advanced Materials Thrust at HKUST(GZ). He received his Ph.D. degree of physics from the University of Colorado Boulder. Before joining HKUST (GZ), he was a postdoctoral researcher at the Oak Ridge National Laboratory. Dr. Li’s research focused on the exploration of quantum many-body states that emerge from charge, spin, and lattice interactions in quantum materials. More specifically, he uses angle-resolved photoemission spectroscopy and various X-ray scattering techniques to study intertwined quantum orders and topological many-body states in novel quantum materials. And he is developing an integrated quantum spectroscopy system for probing electron and phonon structure and dynamics. Dr. Li has published research works in high-profile journals such as Nature Communications, Science Advances, Physical Review X, and Physical Review Letter.
Research Interest: ['Quantum materials', 'Strongly correlated systems', 'Topological electron, magnon and phonon systems', 'Superconductivity', 'Charge density wave', 'Quantum spin liquid']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Data Science and Analytics
Overview: Jia LI is an Assistant Professor in Data Science and Analytics Thrust of HKUST (Guangzhou) and an Affiliated Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science Engineering of HKUST (Hong Kong). He received Ph.D. degree at The Chinese University of Hong Kong in 2021. He worked as a full-time data mining engineer in Tencent from 2014 to 2017, where he was responsible for WeChat and WeBank fraud prevention. Before that, he got M.S. degree in Computer Science at The Chinese University of Hong Kong in 2014 and B.S. degree in Information Engineering at Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications in 2010.
Research Interest: ['Graph Learning, e.g., Hierarchical Graph Neural Networks, Deconvolutional Networks on graph', 'Data Mining, e.g., anomaly detection', 'AI for Science, e.g., drug discovery, healthcare']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Data Science and Analytics
Overview: https://sites.google.com/view/leiliDr. Lei Li is an Assistant Professor at the Data Science and Analytics (DSA) Thrust, Information Hub of the Hong Kong Uni versity of Science and Technology (HKUST GZ). Before that, I was an Associate Lecturer and PhD supervisor at Data Science Group, University of Queensland, Australia, and a data scientist at Redback Technologies. I received my Bachelor and Master s degrees in computer science from Harbin Institute of Technology, China, in 2012 and 2014, and PhD in Computer Science from Data and Knowledge Engineering (DKE) Group in the School of Information Technology and Electrical Engineering, the Univer sity of Queensland under Prof. Xiaofang Zhou s supervision in 2018. I have been working in the area of spatiotemporal data management, route planning in dynamic environment, graph data management, and distributed database systems. I have published actively as the main author in reputed journals and top international conferences including PVLDB, ICDE, TKDE, VLDBJ, DASFAA, WWW and spatial area conferences SIGSPATIAL and MDM.
Research Interest: ['Spatial Database Management', 'Graph', 'Machine Learning', 'Distributed Database']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Earth, Ocean and Atmospheric Sciences
Overview: Dr Li is a physical oceanographer and climate modeler interested in the physics of the ocean and the ocean’s role in the climate system. In particular, he studies the physics of small scale processes at the air-sea interface, such as boundary layer turbulence, ocean surface waves and the resulting ocean mixing. He develops physically-based parameterizations to describe their effects on larger scale processes in climate models and assess their impact on the regional and global climate. He also explores novel approaches to improve the efficiency of numerical models for studying the interactions between physical processes across scales, such as GPU-accelerated computing and multiscale modeling.
Research Interest: ['Planetary boundary layer turbulence', 'Ocean surface waves', 'Numerical modeling', 'Climate sciences']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Siguang LI joined Fintech Thrust, the Society Hub as an Assistant Professor in Fall 2022. His main research interests are in financial economics, applied microeconomic theory, information economics, and mathematical finance.
Research Interest: ['Financial economics', 'Applied microeconomic theory', 'Information economics', 'Mathematical finance']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Bioscience and Biomedical Engineering
Overview: Dr. Xiaomeng Li  is an Assistant Professor in Bioscience and Biomedical Engineering Thrust at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). He obtained his B.Sc. in biological technology  from Zhejiang University and Ph.D. in Chemical Biology from The University of Hong Kong, during which he developed approach to identify histone modification-involved interactions under physiological conditions and investigated the functions of histone crotonylation. Since 2018, he works as postdoctoral fellow at Department of Chemistry, The University of Hong Kong, where he designed and established novel chemical proteomic approach to study the bacteria-host interactions during infection.Dr. Xiaomeng Li's research interests focus on answering the epigenetic questions involving histone PTMs and protein-protein interactions, by combining diverse technologies including photo-crosslinking, bio-orthogonal chemistry, quantitative proteomics and cellular and molecular biology tenchniques, as well as developing novel chemical biology approaches to tackle the current challenges and further the investiation on such problems.
Research Interest: ['Chemical Biology', 'Epigenetics', 'Histone PTMs', 'Protein-protein Interactions', 'Quantitative Proteomics']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Junwei Liang is currently a tenure-track Assistant Professor at The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). He was a senior researcher at Tencent Youtu Lab working on cutting-edge computer vision research and applications. Prior to that, he received his Ph.D. degree from Carnegie Mellon University, working with Prof. Alexander Hauptmann. He is the recipient of Baidu Scholarship and Yahoo Fellowship, and awarded Rising Star Award at the World AI Conference in 2020. He is the winner of several public safety video analysis competitions, including ASAPS and TRECVID ActEV. His work has helped and been reported by major news agencies like the Washington Post and New York Times. His research interests include human trajectory forecasting, action recognition, and large-scale computer vision and video analytics in general. His mission: develop AI technologies for social good.
Research Interest: ['Human trajectory forecasting', 'Action recognition', 'Large-scale computer vision', 'Video analytics in general']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Yuxuan Liang is currently an Assistant Professor at Intelligent Transportation Thrust, also affiliated with Data Science and Analytics Thrust, Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). He is working on the research, development, and innovation of spatio-temporal data mining and AI, with a broad range of applications in smart cities. Prior to that, he obtained his PhD degree at School of Computing, National University of Singapore. He published 40+ papers in refereed journals (e.g., AI, TKDE, TMC) and conferences (e.g., KDD, NeurIPS, ICLR, WWW, ECCV, IJCAI, AAAI, and MM). His publications collectively gathered 2,500+ citations on Google Scholar, with h-index of 23 and i10-index of 34. Among them, three papers were selected as the most influential IJCAI/KDD papers according to PaperDigest. He served as a program committee member for many prestigious conferences, such as KDD, ICML, ICLR, NeurIPS, WWW, CVPR, and ICCV. He also had three-year industrial experience in Microsoft, JD.COM, and Sea AI Lab, He was recognized as 1 out of 10 most innovative and impactful PhD students focusing on Data Science in Singapore by Singapore Data Science Consortium (SDSC) in 2020.

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Bioscience and Biomedical Engineering
Overview: Dr. Liang is an assistant professor in Bioscience and Biomedical Engineering (BSBE) Thrust, Systems Hub, HKUST (GZ), and in The Brain and Intelligence Research Institute. Dr. Liang received his bachelor's degree from Shanghai Jiao Tong University and his Ph.D. degree from The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology with Dr. Nancy Y. Ip. He joined Dr. Frederick W. Alt’s laboratory at Boston Children’s Hospital as a postdoc and became an instructor of Harvard Medical School. Dr. Liang's major research interests focus on the mechanisms of genomic instability in mammalian cells. He has developed new high throughput genomics and animal modeling approaches to study mechanisms that promote and prevent genetic translocations which can lead to cancers and other diseases.
Research Interest: ['Neuroscience', 'Immunology', 'Genomic instability', 'Cancer', 'Neurodegenerative diseases']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Bioscience and Biomedical Engineering
Overview: Dr Julie Qiaojin Lin is an assistant professor in the Bioscience and Biomedical Engineering (BSBE) Thrust, Systems Hub, and in the Brain and Intelligence Research Institute, HKUST(GZ). Dr Lin obtained her bachelor’s degree from HKUST and her PhD from the University of Cambridge as a Gates Cambridge Scholar, trained by Prof Christine Holt. She then joined the UK Dementia Research Institute (DRI) at the University of Cambridge in 2018 as a Sir Henry Wellcome Postdoctoral Fellow and later became a UK DRI Emerging Leader.Her research focuses on multiple aspects of neuronal RNA metabolism, from RNA splicing, localisation to mRNA translation, and the interplay between multiple regulatory processes, particularly those contributing to axonal and synaptic functions and survival. She is also interested in studying the impacts of transient and prolonged changes in temperature and oxygen levels on transcriptomic and proteomic homeostasis in brain cells, and exploring whether certain RNA regulatory processes and machinery are cell-type specific. The findings may provide the molecular basis for the design of neuron-targeted therapies for neurodevelopmental and neurodegenerative diseases.
Research Interest: ['Molecular neuroscience', 'RNA biology', 'Local translation', 'Brain temperature', 'Neuroprotection']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Hao Liu received his Ph.D. degree from the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST) in 2017.  He is currently an assistant professor at the Artificial Intelligence Thrust, HKUST (Guangzhou), and an Affiliated Assistant Professor at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, HKUST (Clear Water Bay).Dr. Liu’s current research interests include spatiotemporal data mining, graph learning, reinforcement learning, and their applications on urban computing, intelligent transportation, and recommender systems.In the past two years, he has filed over 50 Chinese/U.S. patents and published over 20 research papers at prestigious journals and conferences, such as TKDE, SIGKDD, SIGIR, WebConf, VLDB, AAAI, and IJCAI. He also regularly served as the reviewer and (senior) program committee member of many top-tier journals and conferences, such as IEEE TKDE, IEEE TITS, TRC, ACM SIGKDD, AAAI, and IJCAI. In addition, he is the organizer and questioner of the KDD Cup 2019 Machine Learning competition, which has been well-recognized as the world’s top data science competition in the past twenty years.Many of his works have been deployed on real-world products and influenced the daily lives of millions of residents in China. For instance, the multi-modal transportation engine he proposed has been deployed on Baidu Maps and has served over five billion routing requests issued by 200 million distinct users from 2019 to 2020. For his research on intelligent transportation and urban computing, he was named in Forbes 30 Under 30 China list for science and healthcare 2021.
Research Interest: ['data mining', 'machine learning', 'ig data management, with a special focus on mobile analytics and urban computing']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Hongyuan Liu is an Assistant Professor at the Microelectronics Thrust, Function Hub of the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou).  He works in the broad areas of computer architecture and parallel computing, especially emphasizing domain-specific computations on GPUs. Hongyuan received his Ph.D. degree in computer science from William & Mary.
Research Interest: ['Parallel Computing', 'Computer Architecture', 'GPGPUs']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Jinguo Liu acquired his Ph.D. training in Prof. Qiang-Hua Wang's group at Nanjing University on condensed matter physics. After that, he has been a postdoc in Prof. Lei Wang's group at the Institute of Physics (CAS) for two years, a full-time consultant in QuEra computing for half a year, and a postdoc in Prof. Mikhail Lukin's group at Harvard University for two years. His research direction is diverse, while all his studies are about developing new and better algorithms for solving existing or new problems. He is a passionate open source scientific software developer and he has the superpower of speeding up code in his lab by two orders.
Research Interest: ['Quantum computing and reversible computing', 'Tensor networks', 'Automatic differentiation', 'Scientific computing softwares']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Bioscience and Biomedical Engineering
Overview: Dr. Kefei Liu is an assistant professor in Bioscience and Biomedical Engineering (BSBE) Thrust, Systems Hub, HKUST (GZ), and in The Brain and Intelligence Research Institute.He obtained his B.Sc. degree in Pharmaceutical engineering from Jilin University. And received his Ph.D. degree in Neuroscience from Institute of neuroscience, Chinese Academy of Sciences. Then he conducted postdoctoral research at School of medicine, Yale university. Dr. Kefei Liu studies neural activities in visual neural system and hippocampus using in vivo electrophysiology and imaging, to investigate the encoding of outside world by neuronal population activities of the brain during awake and sleeping status, to explore the neural mechanism of spatial navigation, visual perception and learning and memory. He had multiple discoveries in sensory neural systems, then in hippocampus his studies found context orientation selectivity of hippocampal neurons and neuronal sequences generation by short motifs. His studies have been published in Neuron, Science, Nature communications and other high impact international academic journals.
Research Interest: ['System neuroscience', 'Neural coding ', 'Spatial navigation', 'Learning and memory', 'Sleep', 'Hippocampus', 'Visual neural system']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Li Liu is an assistant professor at Artificial Intelligence Thrust, Information Hub, Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). She obtained her Ph.D. degree in 2018 from Gipsa-lab, University Grenoble Alpes (UGA), Grenoble, France. Her main research interests include few-shot learning, AI Security and Transferability, and their applications in audio-visual speech recognition/generation and AI medical Imaging. As the first author or corresponding author, she has published about 30 papers in top journals and conferences in related fields, including IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, IEEE Transactions on Multimedia, NeurIPS, ECCV, MICCAI and ICASSP etc. In 2017, she won the French Sephora Berribi Scholarship for Female Scientists in Mathematics and Computers (totally four in the world, two in France and two in Israel). In the same year, she was awarded a scholarship for young researchers by the French Voice Association (AFCP). Her research has been funded by several scientific research projects, including the National Natural Science Foundation of China-Youth Fund, Guangdong Provincial Natural Science Foundation of Youth Science Fund, Shenzhen Excellent Science and Technology Innovation Talent Doctoral Entrepreneurship Project, Alibaba Innovation Research Fund and Tencent Technology Venture Philanthropy Program. In 2022, her two papers were selected as the Shenzhen Excellent Science and Technology Academic Papers.
Research Interest: ['· Few-shot Learning', '· AI Security and Transferability', '· AI for Medical Imaging', '· Audio-visual Cued Speech Recognition/Generation']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Xiwen Liu is an Assistant Professor at the Microelectronics Thrust, Function Hub of the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). Xiwen received his Ph.D. degree in Electrical and System Engineering from University of Pennsylvania in 2023. His research interests include nanoelectronics devices, emerging memory technology, compute-in-memory system, technology-circuit-architecture co-design, AI accelerator, and unconventional computing.
Research Interest: ['Nanoelectronics Devices', 'Emerging memory Technology', 'Compute-in-Memory', ' AI Accelerator', 'Technology-Circuit-Architecture Co-Design', 'Unconventional Computing']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Earth, Ocean and Atmospheric Sciences
Overview: Dr. Liu is a hydrogeologist focusing on scientific questions related to hydrogeology and biogeochemistry in critical zones such as intertidal aquifer and hyporheic zone. His research investigates the water and chemicals exchange, biogeochemical processes during the surface water - groundwater interaction in river basin systems and land-ocean interaction in coastal aquifer systems. Multiple methods including isotopic tracing, remote sensing, laboratory analysis, field monitoring and numerical modelling are coupled to quantify the contribution and influences of groundwater discharge to the chemical budget and environment in river system and coastal seas.
Research Interest: ['Hydrogeology; Groundwater-surface water interaction; Land-ocean interaction; Carbon and nitrogen cycles']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Earth, Ocean and Atmospheric Sciences
Overview: Dr. Liu is an atmospheric scientist working to advance the understanding of the mechanism and physical processes governing both observed and future climate changes across a wide range of spatiotemporal scales. One of the most important objectives is to reduce uncertainties in future climate projections caused by anthropogenic forcing, such as changes in land use and greenhouse gas concentrations. He has devoted most of his efforts to investigating anthropogenic-induced changes (particularly anthropogenic aerosols) in monsoon circulation and precipitation as well as climate extremes by making use of observations and general circulation models.
Research Interest: ['Aerosol and monsoon climate interactions; Extreme weather and climate events; Regional impacts of climate change; Earth system modelling']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Innovation, Policy and Entrepreneurship
Overview: Dr. Yangsiyu Lu is an assistant professor at the Carbon Neutrality and Climate Change Thrust and the Innovation, Policy, and Entrepreneurship Thrust. Her multi-disciplinary research focuses on energy, climate and the environment, with particular interests in three areas: 1) cleantech innovation, 2) energy finance, and 3) environmental risks.Dr. Lu holds a Ph.D. in Environmental Economics from the University of Oxford, a M.E. in Energy and Environment from IMT Mines Albi (France), and a B.E. in Environmental Science and Engineering from Shanghai Jiao Tong University. Before joining HKUST(GZ), she worked as a research fellow at the Paris School of Economics and Boston University.
Research Interest: ['Cleantech innnovation', 'Energy infrastructure', 'Energy finance', 'Environmental risks', 'Climate policy']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Data Science and Analytics
Overview: Yuyu Luo is an Assistant Professor at the Data Science and Analytics Thrust, Information Hub of The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). He received his Ph.D. degree in Computer Science from Tsinghua University in 2023, under the supervision of Prof. Guoliang Li. His research mission aims to democratize data analytics by simplifying and automating the data analytics pipeline. He accomplishes this by developing systems and tools by leveraging visualization, data management, and artificial intelligence techniques. His primary focus is on assisting users, especially novices, in comprehending and utilizing massive data with ease and efficiency. Specifically, his current research interests include intelligent visual analytics, orchestrating data analytics pipelines, and data management for data science. He has published over 30 papers and demonstrated systems at premier data management and visualization conferences and journals such as SIGMOD, VLDB, ICDE, IEEE VIS, The VLDB Journal, IEEE TKDE, and IEEE TVCG. All research projects are open-source and widely used by enterprises such as Huawei, State Grid, ByteDance, Ant Group, and TAL Education. Additionally, he has also been honored with the 2023 Rising Star in Data Visualization (awarded by CSIG), the 2023 Distinguished Doctoral Graduate and Distinguished Doctoral Dissertation Award from Tsinghua University, the 2020 Tsinghua Top Grade Scholarship (Best 10 Graduate Students), the CIKM 2022 Best Paper Honorable Mention, and the DASFAA 2019 Best Student Paper Award.
Research Interest: ['Intelligent Visualization and Visual Analytics', 'Orchestrating Data Analytics Pipelines', 'Data-centric Artificial Intelligence', 'Data Management for Data Science']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Yangdi Lyu is an Assistant Professor in the Thrust of Microelectronics of the Function Hub at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou), China. He received his B.E. from Tsinghua University in 2011, and Ph.D. from the University of Florida in 2020. His research has mainly focused on designing novel test methodologies to ensure the correctness, trust and security in computing systems, including electronic design automation (EDA), automated test generation, hardware security and trust, verification of quantum computing systems, and robustness of machine learning systems. His research has resulted in 10+ publications in peer-reviewed journals and premier conferences, including IEEE Transactions on Computers, IEEE Transactions on CAD, ACM Transactions on Design Automation of Electronic Systems, and Design Automation and Test in Europe (DATE). His research has been recognized by several awards including Best Poster (Most Popular) Award at ACM SIGDA Student Research Forum at ASP-DAC and nomination for Best Paper Award in DATE 2019. Prior to joining HKUST(GZ), Dr. Lyu worked at Google as a software engineer in California, USA. He currently serves as a technical program committee member of Design Automation Conference (DAC).
Research Interest: ['Automated test generation', 'Hardware security and trust', 'Verification of quantum computing systems', 'Robustness of machine learning systems', 'Electronic Design Automation']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Robotics and Autonomous Systems
Overview: Jun MA received the B.Eng. degree with First Class Honours in electrical and electronic engineering from Nanyang Technological University, Singapore, in 2014, and the Ph.D. degree in electrical and computer engineering from the National University of Singapore, Singapore, in 2018. From 2018 to 2021, he held several positions at the National University of Singapore, Singapore; University College London, London, U.K.; University of California, Berkeley, Berkeley, CA, USA; and Harvard University, Cambridge, MA, USA. He is currently an Assistant Professor with the Robotics and Autonomous Systems Thrust, The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou), Guangzhou, China, and an Affiliate Assistant Professor with the Department of Electronic and Computer Engineering, The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, Hong Kong SAR, China. His research interests include control, optimization, and machine learning with application to robotics and autonomous driving.
Research Interest: ['Motion Planning and Control, Optimization, Machine Learning, Robotics, Autonomous Driving']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: I am an Assistant Professor at the Microelectronics Thrust of The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). Previously, I was a Senior Research Scientist at Huawei Hong Kong Research Center. I received my Ph.D. degree in 2020 from The Chinese University of Hong Kong. My research interests are on the cross-disciplinary study of electronic design automation and machine learning, including agile VLSI design methodologies, machine learning-aided VLSI design, and hardware-friendly machine learning. I am a recipient of the Best Paper Awards at ICCAD 2021, ASPDAC 2021, and ICTAI 2019.
Research Interest: ['Electronic design automation', 'Machine learning-aided VLSI design', 'Domain-specific architecture design', 'Hardware-friendly learning algorithms']
