Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Innovation, Policy and Entrepreneurship
Overview: Dr. Jihoon Shin is an Assistant Professor of Innovation, Policy and Entrepreneurship at the Society Hub of Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). Prof.Shin received his Ph.D in Engineering and Public Policy at Carnegie Mellon University. Prior to joining the HKUST, he worked at Korea Development Bank and Korea Finance Corporation which are Korea’s policy-based financing institutions.His current research interests focus on qualitative and quantitative approaches to technology and innovation policy, with a particular emphasis on the effects of human capital and foreign ownership.
Research Interest: ['Technology management', 'Technology policy', 'Innovation, R&D, High-tech industry']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Robotics and Autonomous Systems
Overview: Dr. Song's research lies at the forefront of human-centric computer vision, delving into the intricate understanding of how humans navigate and interact with their environment, including the objects and surrounding scenes. His primary focus revolves around developing cutting-edge algorithms and methods that enable the spatiotemporal comprehension of human movements and interactions within the physical world. Driven by a learning-based approach, he strives to create novel representations and techniques for deciphering our world through diverse sensor data, encompassing videos, images, and more. His research finds applications in various domains, including Robotics, Augmented and Virtual Reality and Human-Robot Interaction, among others.
Research Interest: ['3D computer vision', 'Reconstrucion', 'Robotics', 'Human-Robot interaction', 'Sim-to-Real']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Xiaotong Sun holds a Ph.D. degree in Civil Engineering from the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering at the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor. She received her master’s degree in Transportation Engineering at the University of Florida in 2016, and her bachelor’s degree in Transportation Engineering with a minor degree in Mathematics from Tongji University, China in 2014. Before joining the thrust of Intelligent Transportation, Systems Hub at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou) as an Assistant Professor in August 2021, she was a postdoctoral research fellow at the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor from 2020 to 2021.Xiaotong’s research interest is interpreting the implications of emerging technologies and services on the transportation systems, and improving strategic decision-making in transportation planning, management, and operations. The methodologies she utilized come from but not limited to optimization, game theory, and mechanism design.
Research Interest: ['Transportation Systems Modelling', 'Resource and Pricing Allocation Mechanisms in Transportation', 'Transportation Network Modeling', 'Mixed Traffic Operations']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Ying Sun received her Ph.D. degree from the Institute of Computing Technology, Chinese Academy of Sciences in 2022. She currently serves as an Assistant Professor in the Artificial Intelligence Thrust at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). Her research interests include Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI), Data Mining, and their cross-disciplinary applications in business, decision-making, and recommendation systems. Over the past five years, Dr. Sun has published numerous academic papers in top-tier journals and conferences such as Nature Communications, TKDE, KDD, NeurIPS, SIGIR, WWW, and IJCAI in the fields of AI, data mining, and their interdisciplinary fields. She has applied for more than 10 patents worldwide. Her pioneering work on market-driven skill pricing has been published in Nature Communications and widely reported by domestic media such as Guangming Daily and China Daily. She also severs as program committee members of top international conferences like IJCAI and AAAI. Dr. Sun has extensive experience in industry practice and maintains long-term academic collaborations with companies such as Huawei, Baidu, OPPO, and BOSS Zhipin. Several of her research achievements have been transformed into product applications. Her proposal "Multi-Source Knowledge Fusion for Financial Event Modeling and Interpretable Knowledge Reasoning" won the Huawei Spark Award. Due to her outstanding academic achievements, Dr. Sun was selected for AI's list of young female Chinese scholars, and has received several honors including the Zhuliyuehua Prize from the Chinese Academy of Sciences, a Baidu Scholarship, and three National Scholarships. In addition, Dr. Sun has rich algorithmic and programming experience and has received honors such as two-time ACM-ICPC Asia Regional Championship Third Place and ACM-ICPC World Final qualification.
Research Interest: ['Explainable Artificial Intelligence', 'Data Mining', 'Machine Learning']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Chee-Keong Tan is an Assistant Professor in the Advanced Materials Thrust of Function Hub at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). He obtained his Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering from the Lehigh University in 2016 and his B.Eng. in Electrical Engineering from the University of Sheffield in 2011. He joined Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering at Clarkson University as an assistant professor since August 2016. His research focuses on semiconductor materials and nanostructures for electronic and optoelectronic devices applications. Tan has extensive experience in semiconductor materials design especially in wide and ultrawide bandgap semiconductors, such as dilute-anion III-Nitride and III-Oxide based materials. Specifically, he has established foundational work in dilute-anion III-Nitride field, bringing up novel concepts that provide breakthrough from fundamental bottlenecks in conventional III-Nitrides. He has authored or co-authored over 30 refereed journal publications.
Research Interest: ['Semiconductor materials and devices']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Data Science and Analytics
Overview: Jing Tang is currently an Assistant Professor in the Data Science and Analytics (DSA) Thrust and an Affiliate Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE), The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST). He received his Ph.D. degree from the Nanyang Technological University (NTU) in 2018 and his B.Eng. degree from the University of Science and Technology of China (USTC) in 2012. Prior to joining HKUST, he was a Research Assistant Professor at National University of Singapore (NUS). His research interests include big data management and analytics, social network and graph analysis, machine learning, and blockchains. He won the Best Paper Award from the IEEE ICNP in 2014 and the Best-in-Session Presentation Award from the IEEE INFOCOM in 2018.
Research Interest: ['Big Data Management and Analytics', 'Social Network and Graph Analysis', 'Machine Learning', 'Blockchains']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Bioscience and Biomedical Engineering
Overview: Dr. Shaojun Tang is an Assistant Professor in Bioscience and Biomedical Engineer Thrust, an affiliated Assistant Professor at Division of Life Science at the Hong Kong University of Science & Technology (HKUST). After graduating from the Sun Yat-Sen University, he went on to USA and obtained his Ph.D. in Bioinformatics and M.Sc. in Computer Science at the University of Florida. He worked as a Postdoctoral Research Scientist in Boston Children’s Hospital, Harvard Medical School. There, he developed a computational method—fCI, which integrates high-throughput transcriptomics & proteomics data and received a patent for the development of a computational method for tauopathy diagnosis and treatment. In 2016, he moved to Georgetown University as an assistant professor working on cancer immunotherapy and translational medicine. He has been focusing on the study of neurodegenerative disease using high-throughput proteomics and transcriptomics data. In addition, he continues to work on cancer genomics and precision medicine. His current interests also include the development of computational methods and machine learning approaches in biology and medicine.
Research Interest: ['Bioinformatics', 'Cancer genomics', 'Precision medicine', 'Neurodegenerative diseases', 'Multi-omics data integration', 'Machine learning']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Bioscience and Biomedical Engineering
Overview: Dr. Li Tao is an assistant professor in the Bioscience and Biomedical Engineering (BSBE) Thrust, Systems Hub, HKUST (Guangzhou), and The Brain and Intelligence Research Institute. She obtained her Ph.D. from Peking Union Medical College/Tsinghua University, where she studied the aging process using quantitative proteomics. Dr. Li Tao then conducted her postdoctoral research at Stanford University/HHMI, focusing on studying neuronal development and functions at the cellular level. In 2023, Dr. Li Tao joined the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou) with research interests centered around understanding the molecular mechanisms that regulate neural development and neurotransmission in normal and age-related disease states. She plans to combine multiple strategies, including genome editing, live-cell imaging, behavioral assays, and large high-throughput proteomics to identify novel regulators that involved in neuronal development and neurological diseases, especially neurodegenerative disorders.
Research Interest: ['Neuronal cell biology', 'Neuronal morphogenisis', 'Neurotransmission ', 'Aging']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Yeyu Tong is an assistant professor at the Microelectronics Thrust, Function Hub of the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). Prior to joining HKUST(GZ) in May 2022, he was an R&D Engineer researching the next generation of silicon photonics technology for high-capacity optical I/O at Interuniversity Microelectronics Center (imec) headquartered in Leuven, Belgium. He completed his Ph.D. at the Chinese University of Hong Kong in 2020 and his B.Eng at UESTC in 2016. he was a visiting researcher at the University of California, Santa Barbara in 2019. His research interests include silicon photonics, advanced photonic integration technology, photonic packaging solutions, optical interconnect, and emerging applications of photonic integrated circuits. He has authored and co-authored about 50 publications including book chapters, journals, and international conferences. He also holds one US patent.
Research Interest: ['Silicon Photonics', 'Advanced Photonic Integration Technology', 'Photonic Packaging Solutions', 'Optical Interconnects', 'Emerging Applications of Photonic Integrated Circuits']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Gareth Tyson holds a PhD from Lancaster University, UK. He has held positions at Queen Mary University of London, King's College London, and the Alan Turing Institute. He has published over 80 papers in the most prestigious conferences and journals in his field, including ACM SIGMETRICS, ACM IMC, ACM WWW, ACM CoNEXT, IEEE INFOCOM and various top IEEE/ACM Transactions. He also serves as an organising/program committee member for a number of premier conferences such as ACM SIGMETRICS, ACM IMC, ACM WWW, ACM CoNEXT, IEEE ICDCS and AAAI ICWSM. His work has have received media coverage from news outlets such as MIT Tech Review, Washington Post, BBC, The Times, Daily Mail, Wired, Ars Technica, and The Register. His research has been awarded the WOAH Shared Task on Hateful Memes Prize 2021; the Best Student Paper Award at the Web Conference 2020; the Best Paper Award at eCrime'19; the Honourable Mention Award at the Web Conference 2018 (best paper in track); and the Best Presentation Award at INFOCOM'18. He received QMUL's Faculty Research Excellence Award in 2021 and the Brendan Murphy Memorial Young Researcher Prize in 2013.
Research Interest: ['Internet Measurements', 'Social Computing', ' Web', ' Cybersafety']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Jun Wang is an assistant professor in the Advanced Materials Thrust at HKUST(GZ), and an affiliate assistant professor in the Department of Chemical and Biological Engineering at HKUST. He obtained his PhD at Ecole Polytechnique, University of Montreal in Chemical Engineering in 2016 followed by postdoctoral trainings at Polytechnique and University of Toronto. Before joining HKUST, he was a research scientist and technical lead in rheology and thermal analysis in the world-leading polyolefin manufacturing company NOVA Chemicals in Canada. Prof. Wang’s current research efforts focus on high-performance polymers and nanocomposites. He is interested in creating multiscale structures through control of interfacial phenomena in heterophase polymer and composite systems to deliver multifunctionality. These materials with tailored structure and properties can find wide applications in electrostatic dissipation control, electromagnetic wave absorption, flexible electronics, oil/water separation, acoustic/thermal insulation, etc. He is also motivated to develop lightweight micro/nano-cellular foams and upcycling/advanced recycling of polymers to enhance material sustainability and circularity. He has had close collaborations with renowned industry partners including ExxonMobil, Arkema, NanoXplore, etc. His work at NOVA Chemicals led to a game-changing technology in metallocene polyolefin processing which is being commercialized. He received the prestigious International Polymer Processing Society’s Young Researcher Travel Award in 2020. He has over 20 peer-reviewed journal papers and filed 5 US patents.
Research Interest: ['Conductive polymers and nanocomposites', 'Polymer foams and porous materials', 'Polymer upcycling and advanced recycling', 'Emulsions and gels']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. WANG Lin (Addison) is an Assistant Professor in the Artificial Intelligence (AI) Thrust of Information Hub (GZ Campus) and an Affiliate Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering (CWB Campus), the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST). He was a Postdoc researcher at the Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST) from August to December 2021. Before that, he got his Ph.D. Degree (with highest Ph.D. Research Award) from KAIST, working with Prof. Kuk-Jin Yoon (KAIST) and Prof. Tae-Kyun Kim (Imperial College London). Dr. WANG had study and research experience in three Departments (Mechanical Eng., Industrial Eng., and Computer Science), and he is familiar with the inter-disciplinary research problems. His research interests lie in computer vision, computational photography, deep learning, and intelligent systems, especially self-driving cars, robotics, VR/AR, and Metaverse. His research highlights are mainly manifested in computer vision with the novel camera sensors (neuromorphic, thermal, and omnidirectional cameras), vision in all seasons, adverse vision problems, low-level vision, and visual understanding for intelligent systems. His research passion is to break the limitations of traditional RGB camera-based computer vision and make the computer vision algorithms more adaptive to tackling real-world problems.
Research Interest: ['Computer vision', 'Computational photography', 'Deep learning', 'Intelligent systems']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Renjie Wang is an assistant professor at the Microelectronics Thrust, Function Hub of the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). He received the B.S. degree in Energy Engineering from Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, in 2010, the M.S. degree in Mechanical Engineering from University of Houston, Houston, in 2012, and the Ph.D. degree in Electrical Engineering from McGill University, Montreal, in 2018. In 2019-2020, he was a postdoctoral researcher with the Engineering Physics at McMaster University, Hamilton. In 2021-2022, he was a Research Associate with the Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Virginia, Charlottesville. His research interests include design, epitaxy, micro/nano fabrication, and characterization of novel semiconductor materials and high-performance devices, and their device integrations for electronic, photonic, and solar energy applications. Specifically, he has been dedicated on optoelectronic and microelectronic devices based on wide-bandgap III-nitride and narrow-bandgap III-V semiconductor. He holds two US patents. He has authored or co-authored over 45 publications including book chapters, journals, and conferences.
Research Interest: ['Optoelectronic and microelectronic materials and devices', 'Epitaxial growth of quantum nanostructures', 'Light emitting diodes, photodiodes, lasers, and their on-chip integrations ', 'Solar cells and solar fuels']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Data Science and Analytics
Overview: Wenjia Wang is an Assistant Professor in the Data Science and Analytics Thrust, Information Hub in the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). He received Ph.D. in Operations Research from the School of Industrial & Systems Engineering, Georgia Institute of Technology, and B.S. in Peking University. His research interests focus on uncertainty quantification, stochastic simulation, machine learning, nonparametric statistics, and computer experiments.
Research Interest: ['Uncertainty Quantification', 'Stochastic Simulation', 'Machine learning', 'Nonparametric Statistics', 'Computer Experiments']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Xiaoyu WANG joined Fintech Thrust, the Society Hub as an Assistant Professor in Fall 2023. Her main research interests are in machine Learning, financial engineering and stochastic systems.
Research Interest: ['Machine Learning', 'Financial Engineering', 'Stochastic Systems']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Xuechao WANG joined Fintech Thrust, the Society Hub as an Assistant Professor in Fall 2023. His main research interests are in decentralized consensus protocols (blockchains). He obtained a Ph.D. in Electrical and Computer Engineering at University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, advised by Prof. Pramod Viswanath. Previously, he obtained his Bachelor Degree in Electronic Engineering at Tsinghua University.
Research Interest: ['decentralized consensus protocols (blockchains)']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Computational Media and Arts
Overview: Zeyu Wang is an Assistant Professor of Computational Media and Arts (CMA) in the Information Hub at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou) and an Affiliate Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology. He leads the Creative Intelligence and Synergy (CIS) Lab at HKUST(GZ). He received a PhD from the Department of Computer Science at Yale University, advised by Profs. Julie Dorsey and Holly Rushmeier, and a BS from the School of Artificial Intelligence at Peking University, advised by Profs. Hongbin Zha and Katsushi Ikeuchi. His research interests are at the intersection of Computer Graphics, Human-Computer Interaction, and Artificial Intelligence, with a focus on algorithms and systems for digital content creation. His work has been recognized by an Adobe Research Fellowship, a Franke Interdisciplinary Research Fellowship, and a Best Paper Award.
Research Interest: ['Drawing analysis and intelligent interfaces, including non-photorealistic rendering and sketch-based modeling', 'Virtual/augmented/extended reality, including 3D scene capture, processing, and editing using LiDAR data', 'Procedural modeling, including parametric generation of visual media like 3D shapes, appearances, and videos', 'AI-based content generation, including neural rendering, digital humans, multimodal creation with text-audio-visual information', 'Applications in art, design, perception, and cultural heritage, such as digitization of Longmen Grottoes and Dunhuang dance']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Wei Wei is an Assistant Professor in the Intelligent Transportation Thrust of the Systems Hub.  She received her B.Eng. degree in Engineering Systems and Design with a focus on Economics and Operations Research from Singapore University of Technology and Design, and the M.Sc. and Ph.D. from the interdepartmental transportation program at Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). She was a postdoctoral associate at MIT’s Institute for Data, Systems, and Society before joining HKUST (Guangzhou) in 2023.Dr. Wei is broadly interested in strategies for technology innovation and infrastructure expansion to decarbonize and integrate transportation and electricity sectors. She is particularly interested in deriving insights on macroscopic strategies/policies that are driven by human travel and energy consumption behavior and transportation/energy technology performance at microscopic and mesoscopic levels. Her work draws on statistical and optimization methods, GIS-based methods, and machine learning. Some of her current areas of interest are:- Coordinated planning of low-carbon transportation and power systems - IoT applications in electric vehicle charging- Transportation and electricity system resilience to climate change induced extreme weather events - Decarbonizing hard-to-abate transportation sectors (shipping, aviation, and road freight)
Research Interest: ['Coordinated planning of low-carbon transportation and power systems', 'IoT applications in electric vehicle charging', 'Transportation and electricity system resilience to climate change induced extreme weather events ', 'Decarbonizing hard-to-abate transportation sectors (shipping, aviation, and road freight)']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Data Science and Analytics
Overview: Dr. Zeyi Wen is Assistant Professor at the Data Science and Analytics (DSA) Thrust of Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, Guangzhou (HKUST-GZ). Before joining HKUST-GZ, he was Lecturer at The University of Western Australia (UWA), Research Fellow at National University of Singapore and The University of Melbourne after PhD completion at The University of Melbourne. Dr. Wen is a winner of Best Paper Award (1 out of 987) at IEEE Transactions on Parallel and Distributed Systems (TPDS) 2019, and Best Paper Award Finalist (4 out of 329) at the 50th International Conference on Parallel Processing (ICPP) 2021. His research work has led to open-source ML systems including ThunderGBM and ThunderSVM. He is an Action Editor of MLOSS section for the Journal of Machine Learning Research (JMLR). More information can be found from https://zeyiwen.github.io/
Research Interest: ['Machine Learning Systems, Automatic Machine Learning, and High-Performance Computing']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Prof. Jiaying Wu is an assistant in the Advanced Materials Thrust, Function Hub, HKUST(GZ) and affiliate assistant professor in the Department of Chemical and Biological Engineering, The HKUST. Her research addresses the device physics and photophysics of new materials for solar energy conversion, including organic and perovskite solar cells as well as materials for photon driven photo-detecting. Her current research focuses on developing fundamental understandings of charge carrier dynamics in photon energy conversion materials/devices by using ultrafast spectroscopy and transient optoelectronic characterizations. She is leading an advanced characterization and analysis team at HKUST(GZ) to address and underpin the fundamental challenges for the next generation materials and technologies. Prof. Jiaying Wu obtained her PhD and MRes degree from Imperial College London (ICL) under the supervision of Prof. James R. Durrant FRS and her bachelor’s degree from the University of Electronics Science and Technology of China (UESTC). Her research has been published in top journals including Science, Energy and Environmental Science, Nature Communications, Joule and Advanced Materials. Prof Wu is recruiting PhD for 2024. Highly motivated students with strong backgrounds in physics, material science, chemistry or mathematics are welcome to send her an email with CV and brief research overview for further information.
Research Interest: ['Photon Energy Conversion                                                                                                                                                     ', 'Photophysics', 'Device Physics', 'Charge Carrier Dynamics']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Xiaoxiao Wu is an Assistant Professor of Advanced Materials Thrust at HKUST(GZ). He received Bachelor’s degree in Physics from Nanjing University in 2014, and PhD degree in Physics from Hong Kong University of Science and Technology in 2018. Before joining HKUST(GZ), he was a post-doctoral researcher in Prof. Xiang Zhang’s group in HKU from 2019 to 2022. His research features extraordinary manipulations of waves beyond conventional limits using metamaterials, which control wave-matter interaction on demand through designed ensembles of artificial structures (“meta-atoms”). With a problem-driven approach, his research experiences span on a variety areas of metamaterials, including wave-functional metamaterials, which aim at challenges impossible for plain natural materials, and topological metamaterials, which aim at exploring the profound topological physics in photonic and phononic systems for fundamental progress and also exotic applications. On wave-functional metamaterials, Dr. Wu designed and realized the first bilayer metasurface for near-unity circular polarization conversion (APL, 108, 183502(2016)). On topological metamaterials, Dr. Wu achieved the first direct observation of valley-polarized edge states (Nat. Comm, 8, 1304 (2017). Citations > 200), and proposed the first scheme for topological corner modes of arbitrary shape (PRL, 126, 226802 (2021)). Until now, he has authored more than 30 journal papers, 11 as the first author or co-first author, 5 as the co-corresponding author, and has published on top journals such as Nature Communications and Physical Review Letters. According to Google Scholar, Dr. Wu has been cited more than 900 times, and more than 600 times as the first author, co-first author, or co-corresponding author, and Dr. Wu’s h-index is 15. He also has 4 granted patents on metamaterials.
Research Interest: ['Metamaterials and wave-matter interactions', 'Functional Metamaterials for EM and acoustic waves', 'Topological photonic and phononic metamaterials', 'Terahertz and sub-terahertz photonics']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Sustainable Energy and Environment
Overview: Dr. Dianxun Xiao is an Assistant Professor in Sustainable Energy and Environment Thrust at Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou) since 2022. He received the B. Eng and M. Eng degrees in Electrical Engineering from the Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China, in 2016 and 2018, supervised by Prof. Gaolin Wang. He was awarded the Ph. D. degree in Electrical & Computer Engineering from McMaster University, Hamilton, Canada, in 2021, supervised by Prof. Ali Emadi. Afterward, he worked as a Postdoctoral Research Fellow at McMaster University before joining the HKUST(GZ). He focuses on transportation electrification and researches control technologies for electric vehicles and more-electric aircraft. He has authored more than 30 peer-reviewed articles in IEEE top journals and conferences and served as the reviewer for more than ten reputational journals in relevant fields.
Research Interest: ['Electric vehicle and More-electric aircraft', 'Electrical machines and control system', 'Battery management system', 'Optimization and data-driven approach', 'Estimation and diagnostic algorithm', 'Robotic servo motor and control']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Hong XING received the B.Eng. degree in Electronic Sciences and Technologies from Zhejiang University, China in 2011, and the Ph.D. degree in Wireless Communications from King's College London, U.K. in 2016. She is currently a Visiting Scholar with the Department of Engineering, King’s College London, U.K.. Since March 2019, she worked as a Research Associate Professor with the College of Electronics and Information Engineering, Shenzhen University, China. She was a Post-Doctoral Research Fellow with the School of Electronic Engineering and Computer Science, Queen Mary University of London, U.K. from October 2017 to January 2019, and with the Department of Informatics, King’s College London, U.K. from February 2016 to September 2017. Her main contribution lies in design and optimization of wireless communications to achieve sustainability, scalability, and security for wireless edge networks, leveraging the synergy of communication, computing, and caching. She is leading one national and one provincial research projects both as PIs. She received the Best 50 of IEEE Global Communications Conference (GLOBECOM) 2014. She also received the Exemplary Reviewer for IEEE Transactions on Communications in 2019 and IEEE Wireless Communications Letters in 2017. She is currently serving as Associate Editor for IEEE Access.

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Urban Governance and Design
Overview: Dr. Wanru Xiong is an Assistant Professor in the Urban Governance and Design Thrust Area, Society Hub at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). She received her Ph.D. in Demography from the Office of Population Research at Princeton University in September 2021, with the dissertation “Sex Ratio Imbalances in China”. She completed her B.A. (2013) and M.A. (2016) in Economics at Peking University. Her research interests include fertility, marriage and family, migration, and population projection. Her research uses quantitative methods to examine dynamics between societal demographic processes and individual decisions about migration, marriage, fertility, and living arrangements.
Research Interest: ['Fertility', 'Marriage & Family', 'Migration', 'Population Projection']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Innovation, Policy and Entrepreneurship
Overview: Dr. Corey XU is an Assistant Professor of Innovation, Policy and Entrepreneurship at the Society Hub of Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). He obtained his Ph.D in Public Administration from Florida State University. His main training is in Public Policy,  Public Administration and Public Management. He also has methodology training in a variety of advanced research methods including Machine Learning, Text Analysis, Network Analysis, Agent Based Modeling, and others. His main research track focuses on how technology shapes government decisionmaking and its impact on the efficiency and equity of public goods. His work has appeared in Public Administration Review, PNAS, Applied Energy, and other journals.
Research Interest: ['Technology and Governance', 'Smart City', 'Big Data Analytics', 'Sustainability', 'Public Policy', 'Public Administration']

Overview: Renjing Xu is an Assistant Professor at the Microelectronics Thrust, Function Hub of the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). He received a B.Eng  (First-class Honor) in photonic system from the Australian National University in 2015 and a Ph.D in applied physics from Harvard University in 2021 (advised by Prof. Donhee Ham). From 2015 to 2016, he was a visiting scholar in the Photonics Lab at University of Wisconsin - Madison.
Research Interest: ['Brain-inspired Device', 'Brain-inspired Hardware', 'Brain-inspired Algorithms', 'Machining Learning and Deep Learning']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Sustainable Energy and Environment
Overview: Dr Chang YAN has been an Assistant Professor in Sustainable Energy and Environment Thrust at Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou) since 2022. He received a Bachelor's degree in metallurgical engineering and a Master's degree in non-ferrous metallurgy from Central South University in 2010 and 2012, respectively. He was awarded PhD degree in Photovoltaic Engineering from UNSW in 2017, supervised by Prof. Martin A. Green and Xiaojing Hao. Then he works as a postdoc and lecturer at UNSW before his appointment at HKUST(GZ). His current research interest focuses on developing next-generation ultra-high efficiency tandem solar cells and flexible & transparent solar cells. He has published over 70 journal articles with the first authorship on the most prestigious journals such as Nature Energy, Advanced Energy Materials, ACS Energy Letters, etc., with over 3000 SCI citations and an H-index of 32. He was included in the top 1% list of global applied physics scientists assessed by standardized citation metrics in the single year of 2020.
Research Interest: ['Wide bandgap inorganic thin film solar cells', 'Ultra-high efficiency tandem solar cell', 'Flexible, wearable, semi-transparent photovoltaic', 'Thin film and nanostructured chalcogenide material for solar fuel production ']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Jia Yan is currently a tenure-track Assistant Professor in the Intelligent Transportation Thrust of the Systems Hub, at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). He received the B.Eng. degree from the School of Electronic and Information Engineering, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, China, in 2017, and the Ph.D. degree in Information Engineering from the Chinese University of Hong Kong in 2021, respectively. He was a Postdoctoral Associate with the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering at the University of Minnesota, Twin Cities, from 2021 to 2023.  His research interests focus on optimization and machine learning techniques in wireless communications and networking, particularly in • mobile edge computing and edge intelligence• wireless federated learning with differential privacy• Internet of Vehicles (IoV) and Internet of Things (IoT)• 5G and beyond systems
Research Interest: ['mobile edge computing and edge intelligence', 'wireless federated learning with differential privacy', 'Internet of Vehicles (IoV) and Internet of Things (IoT)', '5G and beyond systems']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Kezhou Yang joined the Microelectronics Thrust, Function Hub of the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology as an assistant professor in 2023, the same year in which he obtained his Ph.D in materials science and engineering at Pennsylvania State University. Before that, he got his bachlor degree in applied physics at Tongji University in 2018 and master degree in materials science and engineering at Pennsylvania State University in 2019.  His research interest focuses on novel devices technologies for neuromorphic computing. Now he mainly works on hardware-algorithm codesign of spintronic devices for spiking neural networks (SNNs) and Bayesian neural networks. His work includes both simulation and experiment parts.

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Computational Media and Arts
Overview: David is a veteran in creative industries and media education. He joined the TV and Film industries after graduating from UC Berkeley and USC School of Cinematic Arts. Since 1998, David became a founding faculty of the School of Creative Media of City University and later in 2011 a founding faculty of the creative arts programs in animation, visual effects and interactive entertainment of the Open University of Hong Kong. As writer, director and producer, David is active in doing applied projects and consultancy works for government and creative industries. Since obtaining Doctor of Education from University of Bristol in 2015, David has published several book chapters in Springer on interactive media and visual storytelling.

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Huan Yu is an Assistant Professor in the Intelligent Transportation Thrust of the Systems Hub, an affiliated Assistant Professor in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST). Yu received her B.Eng. degree in Aerospace Engineering from Honor School (Elite program) of Northwestern Polytechnical University, and the M.Sc. and Ph.D. degrees in Aerospace Engineering from the Department of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering, University of California, San Diego. She was a visiting scholar at University of California, Berkeley in 2018 and Massachusetts Institute of Technology in 2019. She was a postdoc researcher at University of California, San Diego before joining the HKUST(Guangzhou) in 2021.Dr. Yu is broadly interested in control, optimization, and learning methodologies including Partial Differential Equation Control and Estimation, Dynamical System Modeling, Reinforcement Learning, Extremum Seeking, Adaptive Control, Switched Systems with their applications in intelligent transportation systems (ITS). Her research has been focused on the following directions:PDE model-based control and estimation of traffic flow systems: multi-lane, multi-class, cascaded freeway traffic.Model-free optimization of large-scale urban traffic network systems. Deep reinforcement learning and physics-informed deep learning of ITS.Control and estimation of mixed-autonomy traffic systems with connected and autonomous vehicles platooning and coordination strategies.
Research Interest: ['Intelligient Transportation Systems', 'Control Systems', 'Traffic Flow Modeling and Control', 'Mix-autonomy Traffic with Connected and Automated Vehicles', 'Reinforcement Learning']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Earth, Ocean and Atmospheric Sciences
Overview: Dr Yu is a biogeochemical oceanographer interested in using models and statistical methods to advance marine ecosystem understanding, prediction, and management. She is passionate about developing and applying coupled physical-biogeochemical models to improve quantitative understanding of human impacts on marine ecosystems (e.g., eutrophication, hypoxia, aquaculture, and oil spill) and to explore eco-engineering approaches to mitigate human-caused environmental problems. She is also keen to improve the model estimation and prediction of marine ecosystem processes by applying data assimilation methods that can optimally combine observations and dynamical models.
Research Interest: ['Ocean biogeochemical cycles', 'Marine ecosystem modelling', 'Data assimilation']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Prof. Rongfeng Yuan is an assistant professor in the Advanced Materials Thrust, Function Hub, HKUST(GZ). His prior research focuses on energy transport mechanism of advanced optoelectronics materials as well as fundamental molecular dynamics of complex liquid systems. Using ultrafast spectroscopy and microscopy, he will investigate the interaction between the electronic and nuclear degree of freedom, which are essential for numerous electronic functions of small molecules, biomacromolecules, and optoelectronic materials. Before joining HKUST(GZ), Rongfeng was a postdoctoral scholar at the University of California Berkeley working with Prof. Naomi S. Ginsberg. He obtained his Ph.D. degree from Stanford University under the supervision of Prof. Michael D. Fayer and bachelor’s degree from Peking University.
Research Interest: ['Molecular dynamics', 'Electronic energy transport and conversion', 'Ultrafast spectroscopy and microscopy', 'Optoelectronic materials']

His research interests center primarily around Macroeconomics, Labor Economics, and Entrepreneurship. He extensively uses microdata and equilibrium search models to study issues related to entrepreneurship, unemployment, skill mismatch, health, crime, and their aggregate impacts.

Research Interest: ['Hardware Formal Verification', 'Model Checking', 'Logic Design and Verification']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Dr. Zhang obtained his M.S. and Ph.D. degrees in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Illinois Urbana Champaign. He earned his Bachelor's degree from Zhejiang University. Before he joined HKUST (GZ), he was a postdoctoral associate working with Prof. John Hart in Mechanical Engineering at MIT. Dr. Zhang's main research interests are metal additive manufacturing and advanced composite materials. His group predominantly focuses on the study of material structure and property interplay through the interface across different length scales to unlock nanomaterials' properties at a macroscopic level. In additive manufacturing, his research focuses on new printing techniques development to achieve high resolution, multi-material 3D printing. In composite materials, he works on metal matrix composites (MMC) fabrication and processing and experimental mechanics to explore rational MMC design and manufacturing for enhanced performance and multifunctionality.

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Leifu ZHANG joined Fintech Thrust, the Society Hub as an Assistant Professor in Fall 2023. His main research interests are in fintech, information economics in financial markets, adversarial/strategic ML/AI and its applications.
Research Interest: ['FinTech ', 'Information Economics in Financial Markets', 'Adversarial/Strategic ML/AI & Its Applications', 'Decentralized Finance (DeFi)']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Bioscience and Biomedical Engineering
Overview: Dr. Xian Zhang is an Assistant Professor in Bioscience and Biomedical Engineering Thrust, Systems Hub, and an Affiliate Assistant Professor at the Division of Life Science at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST). Dr. Xian Zhang obtained his Ph.D. in Neuroscience from the University of Science and Technology of China (USTC) to study visual information processing in the visual cortices. Since 2015, he worked as a Postdoctoral Research Scientist to study the neural circuit mechanisms of motivated behaviors in the amygdala at Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory (CSHL) and was awarded by NARSAD as a young investigator for basic research of Major Depressive Disorder in 2020. Dr. Zhang is interested in studying the synaptic and neural circuit mechanisms underlying emotion and motivation. He will take advantage of a wide range of state-of-the-art experimental approaches to determine how does the brain encodes information and to understand the causes of affective disorders.

Title: Assistant Professor

He received his Ph.D. in Economics from Brown University in May 2020. His primary research fields are Microeconomic Theory, Behavioral Economics, and Experimental Economics. His work centers around the role of information and beliefs in economic behavior, ranging from theoretical studies of non-Bayesian belief updating to experimental studies of trust and cooperation.

Research Interest: ['Theoretical and Empirical Climate Asset Pricing', 'Climate Finance', 'Macro Finance', 'ESG', 'Text Mining', 'China Economy', 'Applied Machine Learning']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Ying ZHANG joined Fintech Thrust, the Society Hub as an Assistant Professor in Fall 2023. Typical examples include Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) algorithms for high-dimensional Bayesian inference and Langevin dynamics based algorithms for stochastic optimization problems in machine learning and finance.

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Robotics and Autonomous Systems
Overview: Dr. ZHAO Hang is an Assistant Professor at the Robotics and Autonomous Systems Thrust, Systems Hub, The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, Guangzhou, China, and also an Affiliate Assistant Professor at the Department of Electronic and Computer Engineering, The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, Clear Water Bay, Hong Kong SAR, China. He received the B.Eng. and M.Eng. degrees from Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China, and the Ph.D. degree from City University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong SAR, China, all in electrical engineering in 2015, 2017, and 2021, respectively. Before joining HKUST, He worked as a postdoctoral fellow at The University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong SAR, China. His research focuses on energy conversion and autonomous systems, emphasizing 1) design, modeling, and optimization of motor topologies; 2) machine-learning-based control strategies for motor drives; 3) application of motor drives in robots and electrified transportation; 4) smart grid with renewable energy.
Research Interest: ['Electric machine design and optimization', 'Learning-based control for motor drives', 'Transportation electrification', 'Mechatronics design for robots', 'Smart grid with renewable energy']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Xinhu Zheng is currently an Assistant Professor in the Intelligent Transportation Thrust of the Systems Hub, at Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (GZ). He received his Ph.D. degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering from the University of Minnesota, Minneapolis, in 2022. He has published 20 papers on peer-review journals and conferences, including IEEE Internet of Things Journal, IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Transportation Systems, IEEE Transactions on Systems, Man, and Cybernetics: Systems, etc. He is currently an Associated Editor for IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Vehicles.His current research interests including data mining, multi-agent information fusion, multi-modal data fusion and data analysis in intelligent transportation system and ITS related intelligent systems, by exploiting different modality of data, leveraging optimization and machine learning techniques.
Research Interest: ['Intelligent Transportation System Autonomous Driving', 'Environment Perception', 'Connected Intelligence', 'Multimodal Data Fusion']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Urban Governance and Design
Overview: Dr. Muzhi Zhou is an Assistant Professor in the Urban Governance and Design Thrust at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou) beginning from January 2022. Previously, she was a postdoctoral researcher at the Department of Sociology, University of Oxford. Dr. Zhou received her Ph.D. in Sociology from the University of Oxford in 2019. She has expertise in the field of gender, life course, and family studies. She studies how critical life events, such as marriage and childbirth, reshape people’s lives in East Asia, Europe, and the United Kingdom, where the culture, social policies and welfare regimes differ. She also works on how children spend their time, especially adolescents’ time on the internet and computer, and its implications. Her work has been published in Gender & Society, Demographic Research, PLoS ONE, and Chinese Sociological Review.
Research Interest: ['Children & Family', 'Ageing & Care', 'Comparative Study', 'Digital Technology & Digital Divide', 'Time Use']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Sustainable Energy and Environment
Overview: Prof Teng Zhou is an Assistant Professor in the Sustainable Energy and Environment Thrust at Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou) since 2022. His research focuses on Process and Energy Systems Engineering, including CO2 capture material and process design, CO2 conversion process design, hybrid renewable energy systems modeling and optimization, as well as the optimal design of energy storage/conversion devices. Dr. Zhou obtained his doctoral degree from the Max Planck Institute for Dynamics of Complex Technical Systems in 2016. He continued working as a Team Leader at the Max Planck Institute and W1 Professor at Magdeburg University before joining HKUST (GZ). Until May 2022, Dr. Zhou has published more than 30 journal articles as the first or corresponding author. He is acting as an Associate Editor, Guest Editor, and Editorial Board Member for several international journals. He is also the Scientific Committee Member for the International Symposium on Process Systems Engineering and European Symposium on Computer-Aided Process Engineering. Dr. Zhou earned many prestigious honors and awards, including the Future Chemical Engineering Scholar granted by the Global Academy of Chinese Chemical Engineers (GACCE) and CAST Directors Award granted by the American Institute of Chemical Engineers (AIChE).
Research Interest: ['CO2 capture material and process design', 'CO2 conversion process design', 'Hybrid renewable energy systems modeling and optimization', 'Optimal design of energy storage/conversion devices (e.g. flow battery)']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Sustainable Energy and Environment
Overview: Dr. Zhou obtained his Bachelor from PLA (people’s liberty army) university of Science and Technology in 2014, Master’s degree from Hunan University in 2017 and PhD degree in 2021 from Hong Kong Polytechnic University (HKPolyU). Dr. Zhou conducted his PhD attachment program in 2019 in Eindhoven University of Technology, Netherlands, under the supervision of Prof. Jan L.M. Hensen. He joined in Hong Kong University of Science and Technology in 2021. He was awarded the Best Paper Award in CUE2020: Applied Energy Symposium:-Low carbon cities and urban energy systems, organized by Applied Energy journal. He has 3 highly cited papers (ESI 1%). He won the award ‘Outstanding PhD candidate in international conference on Energy and Built Environment’ in 2021. Dr. Zhou is invited as guest editor to launch a special issue ‘Energy Flexible Buildings with Energy Conversion and Management Technologies’ in the SCI journal, Applied Sciences, in 2021. Dr. Zhou was also invited to contribute chapters in 7 books (publishers: Elsevier, Springer and so on). Dr. Zhou’s research aims at achieving smart zero-energy and zero-carbon district energy systems for carbon neutrality and climate change mitigation, via cleaner power production, energy-efficient system design and operation, innovation in smart energy integration, multi-objective optimization on nonlinear dynamic behaviours with artificial intelligence. Cross-disciplinary areas and multidisciplinary research with cutting-edge technologies are required, including materials engineering, chemical engineering, thermodynamics, computational fluid dynamics, renewable energy engineering, energy economics, and artificial intelligence. His current research interests include electrochemical battery, hydrogen and pumped hydro storages in zero-energy buildings, life-cycle carbon-neutral buildings, peer-to-peer energy trading and inter-city energy migration energy network with hydrogen economy. Up until now, he has published over 35 SCI papers in high impact journals. He is currently serving as an editorial board member for Journal of Architectural Environment & Structural Engineering Research (JAESER). He also serves as reviewer for high-impact SCI journals, such as Nano Energy, Renewable & Sustainable Energy Reviews, Applied Energy, Energy Conversion and Management; Journal of Cleaner Production, Sustainable City and Societies, Energy; Renewable Energy; Solar Energy; Building and Environment; Journal of Energy Storage, and so on.
Research Interest: ['Zero-energy buildings', 'Energy flexible buildings', 'Renewable energy', 'Advanced energy management strategies with battery and hydrogen storages', 'Latent heat storage', 'Smart and optimal systems with machine-learning']

Title: Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Robotics and Autonomous Systems
Overview: Lei ZHU is currently working as an Assistant Professor at ROAS Thrust, HKUST(GZ), and also an Affiliated Assistant Professor, ECE, HKUST. Before that, he has been a postdoctoral researcher at University of Cambridge, the Hong Kong Polytechnic University and the Chinese University of Hong Kong. He received his PhD degree at Department of Computer Science and Engineering from the Chinese University of Hong Kong in 2017.  His research interest is to develop AI-powered image perception theory and algorithms for outdoor vision systems, multimedia, and healthcare. In past a few years, his works have been published in top-tier conferences or journals, including CVPR/ICCV/ECCV, AAAI/IJCAI/ACMMM, IEEE TPAMI/TIP/TMM/TCSVT/, IEEE TMI/Medical Image Analysis/MICCAI, and so on. He has served on an area chair for ACM MM 2021, and continuously reviewed for top journals and conferences (CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ICLR, AAAI, IJCAI, ACM MM, MICCAI, IEEE TIP, TMM, TCSVT, TMI, etc.).
Research Interest: ['Computer Vision, Computational Photography, Image/Video Restoration, Computer Graphics, Medical Imaging, and Deep Learning']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Meixin Zhu obtained a Ph.D. degree in intelligent transportation at the University of Washington (UW) in 2022. He joined HKUST(GZ) as an assistant professor in the Systems Hub, Intelligent Transportation Thrust in Sep. 2022. He was a Software Research Intern at Motional for autonomous driving behavior planning during Spring and Summer of 2022. He was an applied scientist intern at Amazon in Summer 2021. He worked as a research intern at the Oak Ridge National Laboratory from June to December, 2019. He is a younger committee member of the Connected & Autonomous Vehicles (CAV) Impacts Committee and Artificial Intelligence Committee of ASCE Transportation & Development Institute (T&DI). He is also a committee member of the Subcommittee on Connected and Automated Traffic Flow (CAT-Flow), TRB Committee on Traffic Flow Theory and Characteristics (ACP50). He acts as a reviewer for more than 20 journals and conferences, including NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, ICRA, Transportation Research Part C, IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Transportation Systems, IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Vehicles, Accident Analysis & Prevention, etc.His research interests include Autonomous Driving Decision Making and Planning, Driving Behavior Modeling, Traffic-Flow Modeling and Simulation, Traffic Signal Control, and (Multi-Agent) Reinforcement Learning.
Research Interest: ['Autonomous Driving', 'Driving Behavior Modeling', 'Traffic-Flow Modeling and Simulation', 'Traffic Signal Control', '(Multi-Agent) Reinforcement Learning']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Zhirui Zong is an Assistant Professor at the Microelectronics Thrust, Function Hub in the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). He received the PhD degree from Delft University of Technology (The Netherlands) in 2019 and B.Eng. degree from University of Electronic Science and Technology of China in 2012. Prior to joining HKUST (GZ), Dr. Zong has spent 4 years in industry, working on RF analog IC design in NXP and SiTime. His research interests include phase-locked loop design, RF and mm-wave integrated circuits design, and high-speed circuits for wireline communications. He has published 10+ papers in peer-reviewed journals and conferences (including IEEE JSSC, ISSCC, IEDM), 1 book chapter and holds 3 US patents. One of his research outcomes has been adopted in a commercial product.
Research Interest: ['Phase-locked loops (PLL) and frequency synthesizers', 'RF and millimeter-wave integrated circuits design', 'High-speed data communication circuits design']

Title: Assistant Professor
Overview: Ruiting ZUO joined Fintech Thrust, the Society Hub as an Assistant Professor in Fall 2022. Her research interests cover Finance-Operations Interface, E-commerce and marketplace analytics, Operations-Marketing Interface, Game theory, optimal control, data-driven decision making, etc.
Research Interest: ['Finance-Operations Interface', 'E-commerce and marketplace analytics', 'Operations-Marketing Interface', 'Game theory', 'Optimal control', 'Data-driven decision making']

Title: Senior Lecturer
Overview: Dr. Clive LEE is Senior Lecturer of the Centre for Language Education. He received his Ed.D. from the University of Exeter in 2020. His research interests are in the cultural aspects of English language learning and teaching.

Title: Senior Lecturer
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Computational Media and Arts

Title: Senior Lecturer
Overview: Dr. Claire XING (XING Qingqing) has more than 20 years of experience using English as a medium for scientific and technical communication. She began her career as an English teacher at Beijing Institute of Technology in 2001, teaching both UG and RPG students in college English and various types of post-graduate language courses. Her contribution to science and technology communication includes textbooks for Chinese and international students. In 2011-2012, she was the Program Manager in the Bureau of International Cooperation at the National Science Foundation of China, responsible for managing the Research Fund for International Young Scientists. As an Associate Professor of Applied Linguistics (2009-2021), she taught a variety of courses such as Business English for MBA students and Developmental and Educational Psychology for master's students in education. She has also supervised more than 20 master's students in writing their theses. Dr. Xing's role as the Associate Director of the International Office at Beijing Institute of Technology (2012-2021) fostered her passion and experience in developing inbound and outbound initiatives to help students with science and technology backgrounds communicate internationally.
Research Interest: ['Science Communication; Education Sciences; Language Education']

Title: Lecturer I
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Computational Media and Arts
Overview: As an artist, Rui Hu works with moving image, 3D graphics, installation, game and virtual simulation technology. His practice explore the topics of time and temporality from a multitude of perspectives, such as causality, prediction, simulation, and disaster studies. Recently, he is also pursuing research in philosophy of science and technology. He holds an MFA (a terminal degree in arts practice) in Design / Media Arts from the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) and a BFA in Film from New York University's Tisch School of the Arts. Rui Hu’s work has been featured by Artforum, 艺术论坛 (Artforum China), Ocula, Killscreen, etc. He recently received the Best Experimental Animation Award at the 60th Ann Arbor Film Festival, an artist residency at the Swatch Art Peace Hotel Shanghai, a Jury Special Mention at the 25FPS Festival in Croatia, and was a finalist of the ifva Award from the Hong Kong Arts Centre. He has participated in exhibitions and screenings at art spaces, institutions, and film festivals internationally, including the UCCA Center for Contemporary Art, International Film Festival Rotterdam, Hong Kong Arts Centre, Ann Arbor Film Festival, International Symposium on Electronic Art (ISEA), Derby QUAD Arts Centre, Vienna Shorts Film Festival, Images Festival at the Art Gallery of Ontario, VIVO Media Arts Centre, among others.
Research Interest: ['Media Arts (applied computer graphics in art, simulation, game, and virtual reality in art; film and animation; installation art)', 'Philosophy (time, causation, process, simulation)']

Title: Lecturer I
Overview: Dr Yanhua Liu is a lecturer at the Division of Language Education (DLE) with over a decade of teaching experience across China, the UK, and Singapore. He earned his PhD, MA, and Postgraduate Diploma in English Language Teaching (with Distinction) from Nanyang Technological University, Singapore. At HKUST (GZ), he teaches on common core  courses for UG students, as well as PG courses and professional development workshops. He has also taught on the RBM programme’s Design Thinking course and provides one-to-one tutorials on academic writing and speaking. His research in English for Academic Purposes focuses on spoken academic genres for non-specialists, particularly the Three Minute Thesis (3MT) presentations. His work can be found in leading journals such as Journal of English for Academic Purposes and English for Specific Purposes. He is the PI and Co-PI of several research projects. He has been invited to give research talks at workshops in Singapore, Indonesia, and China. Dr Liu sits on the Editorial Board of Computers and Composition (Scopus). He is a peer reviewer for English for Specific Purposes (Elsevier), Journal of English for Academic Purposes (Elsevier), and International Journal of Educational Management (Emerald). He is a member of BALEAP, British Association for Applied Linguistics (BAAL), and Singapore Association for Applied Linguistics (SAAL).
Research Interest: ['English for Academic Purposes; (Multimodal) Discourse Analysis; Scientometric Review']

Title: Lecturer I
Overview: Jaeuk Park is a lecturer in the Centre for Language Education (CLE) at HKUST (GZ) where he has been a faculty member since August, 2022. He obtained his undergraduate degree in Economics (2006) from Pusan National University in Pusan, Korea. Jaeuk received two MA degrees, one in Interpretation and Translation of English-Korean (2009) from Busan University of Foreign Studies and the other in Applied Linguistics & TESOL (2010) from Newcastle University. He received his Ph.D. in Educational and Applied Linguistics (2018) from Newcastle University under the supervision of the Professor Paul Seedhouse and Dr. Rob Comber. After brief stints as an instructor at Newcastle University, he was appointed to the School of Language, Cultures and Societies at the University of Leeds in 2017 as a lecturer. Jaeuk also worked as a professional interpreter and translator (English-Korean) for many private and public areas for more than seven years. Having mobilised his knowledge and understanding of two different languages and academic backgrounds, he has been able to build up a great sense of interdisciplinary projects and to adapt well to cross-faculty working environments. Prior to coming to China, Jaeuk enjoyed travelling, playing the guitar, watching movies, and enjoying good local foods. He still likes all of them.
Research Interest: ['Second Language Acquisition (SLA)；Computer-Assisted Language Learning (CALL)；English for Academic Purposes (EAP)； multimodality and interactional competence']

Title: Lecturer I
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Computational Media and Arts
Overview: Jake Zhang Junjie is an award-winning independent animation artist, illustrator and educator living in LA and Hong Kong. He likes to explore and develop different visual styles to express his artistic opinions and stories. Most of his films are dark-humorous, ironic and fantastic, reflecting social and political issues indirectly. Jake Zhang holds a BA in Digital Media from China Central Academy of Fine Arts and a MFA in Animation and Digital Arts from University of Southern California. His films have been awarded and selected in festivals all over the world, including Jury Award in 55th Ann Arbor Film Festival (2017), Storytelling Designation Winner in Adobe Design and Achievement Award (2015), Nomination in 58th CINE Golden Eagle Award (2015), the Best 2D project in The Vision Feast, Distinction Award in Athens Animation Festival (2016), Winner in Animaze Animation Day in Cannes Film Festival (2016), Official selection in KLIK! Amsterdam Animation Festival (2015), Corfu Animation Festival (2015), Cutout Fest International Animation and Digital Art Festival (2015), Animasyros International Animation Festival (2015) and  Melbourne International Animation Festival (2014). Currently, Jake lives in Hong Kong. After serving as Professor of Animation at Savannah College of Art and Design for five years, he is now one of founding faculties and Assistant Professor of Practice in Digital Arts at Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, Computational Media and Arts thrust area. His research interest include storytelling in virtual reality, screen design & world building strategies, Creator & user experience in process of creating. Besides, he has founded his artist studio Jake Weird Power in Jockey Club Creative Arts Centre since August, 2019.

Title: Lecturer II
Overview: After earning her master’s degree in International Language Education from HKUST, Jade (Wei ZHANG) started her English teaching career in nationally renowned tutoring companies and gained experience in curriculum design and teacher training. Prior to joining HKUST(GZ), she developed and taught a range of English courses and organized English events for undergraduates in South China University of Technology. Guided by a student-centered teaching philosophy, she believes in embracing and making the most of the uniqueness and expertise of every individual in class, and strives to build inclusive and cooperative learning spaces in this interdisciplinary environment.

Title: Lecturer II
Overview: Jinni Zhou received a Ph.D. degree in Electronic and Computer Engineering from HKUST in 2019. Inspired by the innovation and entrepreneurship culture in her research group which incubated a lot of startups, including DJI, Googol, QKM, ePropulsion, etc., she was committed to exploring new pedagogy for cross-disciplinary education and cultivating innovative talents for society. She attended the summer institute and got the professional development program certificate of “Designing Student-Centered Learning Experiences” held at Olin College of Engineering in 2019. She is currently a lecturer in the area of Computational Media and Arts (CMA) at HKUST, mainly responsible for teaching two common core courses: Cross-Disciplinary Research Methods and Cross-Disciplinary Design Thinking. Jinni Zhou’s research work has been published in several top journals and conferences in the robotics area, including the International Journal of Micro Air Vehicles (IJMAV), Robotics and Automation Letters (RAL), International Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems (IROS), International Conference on Unmanned Aircraft Systems (ICUAS), etc.

Title: Research Assistant Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Carbon Neutrality and Climate Change
Overview: Dr. Coco DU is Research Assistant Professor at the Carbon Neutrality and Climate Change Thrust Area, Society Hub, the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). She received her PhD from the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology in Environmental Science, Policy and Management. She also holds an MA in Environment, Politics and Globalization from Kings College London.Her research primarily focuses on environmental policy, green finance and regional innovation. Her publications have appeared in peer-reviewed journals including Chinese Journal of Population Resources and Environment, Journal of Chinese Governance, China: An International Journal, Governance Studies and Technology in Society.She is also interested in applying research to address real-life policy problems. She is a Co-Investigator for the Strategic Public Policy Research Project “Developing a Green Finance Centre in Hong Kong in the Context of Green Development of the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area: Institutional Analysis and Policy Design”, funded by the Policy Innovation and Coordination Office of the Hong Kong Government.
Research Interest: ['Environmental policy', 'Policy process theory', 'Green finance policy', 'Regional innovation system']

She received her B.S. degree from Xi’an Jiaotong University in 2018 and obtained her PhD from the Chinese University of Hong Kong in Mechanical and Automation Engineering. Her current research interests include soft electronics for biomedical therapies, high performance triboelectric nanogenerators, high-voltage applications of triboelectric nanogenerators, triboelectric effect enabled self-powered sensing systems, mechanism of contact electrification and discharge, mechanism of contact electrification and discharge.

Overview: Albert Park is a development and labor economist who is an expert on China’s economic development. He is Director of the Institute for Emerging Market Studies, Head and Chair Professor of Economics, Chair Professor of Social Science, and Professor of Public Policy at HKUST. Professor Park is a Research Fellow of the Centre for Economic Policy Research (London), the Institute for the Study of Labor (IZA, Bonn), the International Growth Centre (Oxford/LSE/DFID), and the Human Capital and Economic Opportunity Working Group (Chicago). In recent years he has published articles in leading economics journals on firm performance, poverty and inequality, migration and employment, health and education, and the economics of aging in China. He serves on the editorial boards of the World Bank Economic Review, Journal of Pension Economics and Finance, Cambridge University Press Elements Series in the Economics of Emerging Markets, and China Policy Journal. Prof. Park has played a leadership role in numerous survey research projects in China including the China Employer-Employee Survey (CEES), the China Urban Labor Survey (CULS), the Gansu Survey of Children and Families (GSCF), and the China Health and Retirement Longitudinal Study (CHARLS). He previously held faculty appointments at the University of Michigan and Oxford University and has consulted frequently for the World Bank. His research and commentary has appeared in the Economist, New York Times, Washington Post, Wall Street Journal, BBC, CNN, Bloomberg, Freakonomics, and NPR.

Currently, he is a Chair Professor of Division of Life Science, and the Director of Center for Chinese Medicine R & D at the university. Prof. Tsim has developed molecular technique to determine the genetic and chemical properties of Chinese herbs. He serves as editors for many scientific journals internationally. His works on Chinese herbal medicine have been awarded twice for Research Excellence in Natural Sciences from Ministry of Education of China. He also serves as an advisor/consultant/member to various organizations, both nationally and internationally, in the standardization of Chinese herbs, which include WHO and HKSAR Government in Testing and Certification of Chinese herbs. Overview: Dr. Haibin Su is an Associate Professor at Department of Chemistry in The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology since 2018. He graduated from University of Stony Brook, while performing his thesis projects in Center for Data Intensive Computing at Brookhaven National Laboratory. Then he went to Caltech for his PostDoctor prior to joining Nanyang Technological University in 2005. His research interest includes development and application of theoretical and computational physical science: i.e., quantum-mechanical and classical simulations and modeling of the structural, kinetic, and dynamic properties of complex functional systems, in particular emergent collective properties at multiple spatial and temporal scales.

Title: Affiliate Associate Professor
Thrust/Department/Division: Thrust of Urban Governance and Design
Overview: Jin Wang is an associate professor of Social Science at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology. She was educated at the Tsinghua University of China for her BA and MA in Economics before getting her PhD in Economics from the London School of Economics and Political Science. Her research, which mostly has a policy focus, is mainly in the areas of Development Economics, Public Economics and Chinese Economy. She worked on a variety of topics – place-based policies, government hierarchy and incentives, and the labor mobility barriers that are embedded in the hukou household registration system of China. Her work has appeared in a range of economics journals including Journal of the European Economic Association, American Economic Journal: Economic Policy, Journal of Development Economics and Journal of Comparative Economics.
Research Interest: ['Development Economics', 'Public Economics ', 'Chinese Economy']

Overview: Prof. WANG, Ph.D. in Economics from the New York University (2009), is currently the Affiliate Associate Professor of Fintech Thrust. His research interests cover areas of Applied econometrics, Econometrics, Empirical macroeconomics and Time series econometrics.
